RECOMMENDATION: For a great breakfast, you have to go to the Peppermill. It is located center strip and should be easily accessible from any of the Las Vegas hotels. It is truly a unique experience.
Had the chicken with Dijon sauce, was excellent. The mashed potatoes were especially creamy and good. Service was good. The ambiance was old hooker Vegas.
I like the lounge to have a quiet drink in but the food is really bad.  out of the freezer, into the fryer is not a recipe for good eats.

This place is a really cool place to eat at. The seats are comfy, lights are cool, and fake trees and bushes inside. Our waiter Sarah B. was super nice and wasn't rude at all!

Pros:
Nice Staff
Comfy Seats
Cool Lights

Cons:
None
Fun retro restaurant decor combined with strong offerings and cocktails makes this choice idiot proof. Serving sizes are bordering on silly. This is positively the most Vegas of any Vegas restaraunt.

this is for the fireside lounge 
so my  boyfriend surprised me by taking me here so i could try a scorpion for the 1st time and it was what i expected it to be delicious but what would keep me from coming back was the service the bar tender gave us was awful. he was rude to my boyfriend for no reason we were polite and told him what we wanted and asked him before he made the drink if we could have it to-go he said yes so when we grabbed the drink he stopped us and said we couldn't take it out and had to pay for the glass did he not say it was fine for us to have it to-go before we paid for it so we ended up paying $24 for my one drink and he still expected a tip old man please your not getting shit 
would i go back maybe in a few years once the bartender is no longer there

After a very long wait we were pleased to see generous portions. Had a burger and gyro, overall pretty good. Service was a little lacking but they were slammed so understood. Breakfasts are definitely big enough to share!

Great food and great service. We loved it all. 
I'm giving 4 out of 5 because there was a 30 minute wait, the table wasn't cleaned yet, there was no silverware and the waitress gave 3 of our 4 plates to the wrong person. Long line when we left too.

Best place to go for late night grub, serving size is huge and if you have a sweet tooth I would recommend the mud pie.  Its super chocolatey goodness with a large amount of ice cream.  The strawberry shortcake and brownie desserts come in a huge glass cup with ice cream which are also great . It's a diabetic coma waiting to happen .

how can you not love peppermill? portions are huge, quality is like diner food. funky retro interior is the real reason you go. my sister and I shared a club sandwich with onion rings and we still had food left over. so even though it seemed like a pricey sandwich it really was a ton of food. it can get very busy for late breakfast. i think they're open 24 hours and have a full bar. the servers are nice and pretty chill, especially if it's not busy.

"Good diner with easy access"

Service - 8 out of 10 (very fast service)
Location - 8 out of 10 (easy free parking and safe area)
Food Quality - 8 out of 10 (very large portions)
Price - 7 out of 10 (not too bad for LV)

This is above average place for a quick meal in LV. The servers are nice and everything I've had there was good. The only complaint I have is the outrageous prices for basic drinks. (Tea 2.50, milk 3.00) This is not just a peppermill thing... all of LV thinks any drink is worth a fortune. (Bottle beers are 7.50 in most places)

Overall this is a great place!

PS: No hats in the Fireside Lounge.

This is our go to spot since we don't have a huge appetite and don't want to splurge $40+ bucks on a pricey buffet.  This is the place to go if you want a good price, large portion & delicious meal.  Their omelettes have 10 eggs, so this gives you an idea as to how big a portion they serve.  My recommendation if you don't eat a lot, split it.  Also, if there's a waiting time go to the fireside lounge through the glass doors if you're 21+ as you can order cocktails while you wait and the waiting time won't seem so long.
One of the best local late night hangouts in Vegas! Whenever friends or family come to town I make sure to take them to the fire pit room.

Peppermill is popular amongst the Vegas clubbing crowd. I have no clue what this place would be like at regular hours of the day, but think Denny's or The Pantry. The prices reflect that of the Vegas markup too, but you come to expect that on the strip. The first thing that you would notice on the menu would be the breakfast emphasis. I've only done breakfast here and it's rather good, even at 4 am.

-=-Southern fried steak-=- I got this meal with eggs. That's the perfect way to do chicken fried steak. It's definitely top 5 in my list of chicken fried steaks. You just can never go wrong with a fried piece of steak. The gravy that they add on top as well is savory, flavorful, and not too overbearing. If you want something breakfast meaty, and don't mind a huge chicken nugget, get this. I was able to get away with only eating half, and saving the rest for later, so fear not hungry men, this will fill you.

Stopped here for lunch after a long day of walking the strip. Saw this place on Las Vegas Magazine and it had some good reviews. I also yelped it BEFORE I came and it had my MANDATORY 4 stars! The only weird, "negative" thing would be the fake flowers everywhere. I kept hearing Robert Irvine from restaurant impossible in my head "these fakes flowers gotta go!". Other than that, no complaints whatsoever.
Service was good. Prices were good, STRIP prices, so it's not cheap, but not over the top strip prices either. Food was pretty damn good too. My cousin got the pastrami sandwich. It looked really good. Large sandwich and lots of fries. He also got the margarita with the corona in it. I'd seen those in SA (wish I got one there). He really enjoyed his meal. I got the tomato, mozzarella and basil on "toasted" ciabatta bread. The bread could have been toasted more (but that's my preference). The pesto was tasty. There was a really nice amount of fresh mozzarella. The tomatoes could have been better. They were a little mushy, but when eaten as a sandwich, you didnt notice. I got onion rings (LOVE THEM!!!!) as my side. They were very good. There just wasn't too much to offer vegetarians, but I would recommend and might come back!

The wife and I pulled into the Peppermill to start off our Vegas trip and were completely amazed at how good the chicken fried steak and eggs and eggs Benedict were. Totally recommend stopping here before hitting the strip.

Had an excellent time at Fireside lounge. I sat right next to one of the fire pit areas with my wife which was very romantic. We had some appetizers and a few drinks. The drinks could have been cheaper, but I enjoyed the atmosphere and the experience.

This was a great place all the way around. Neon lights inside and out..the food was huge portions amd really good.everything we had was delicious...the atmosphere was fun too..they have colored sugar on your table for coffee etc.pretty cool

It's a lounge, baby!  This is old swanky Vegas at its trashy best, complete with indoor fireplace.  You must go and have a cocktail.  Heck, stay for dinner.  Or do as this website sez and have a nice makeout session:  http://www.vegas.com/nightlife/bars/peppermill.html.
It was great, staff was nice , food was fabulous and you get plenty of food,waitress was kind and did a great job..... plenty of food to choose from,
Great place. Very fun, retro experience. I had the French toast collage. Great portion size. French toast was nice and fluffy and Sausage are huge. Nice variety of options on the menu and cool drinks

Food was alright, large portions of eggs with whatever you get. They were out of corn beef hash by 1 pm? The eggs Benedict were B class. The San Francisco scramble was much better. Mostly I was turned off by the customer experience during my first and only trip there. We approached the counter where the hostess were hanging out, and were not greeted. I had to make awkward eye contact in order to get noticed. Lots of gossiping from the hostess and the overfilled entry made my boyfriend and I head to the bar. Drinks were made with no gusto, and none of the bartenders knew of any specials and referred me to the manager to figure that one out. Hello, it's Super Bowl Sunday on the strip, know your business better. Fast forward a half hour later, sitting down and were asked by waitress if we needed more time, and for the sake of time we ordered promptly. There were so many loud groups and fluorescent lighting I would not recommend for an intimate nor family setting. After our check was brought, I inquired whether I could pay with the waitress, she said okay and walked away. -__- If you're in the area I would try it on a not so busy day. If you're traveling more than 4 miles, avoid and head to a decent restaurant where even if it's busy, customer satisfaction will not be sacrificed.

I can honestly tell you from intimate experience that this place is fantastic the food is delicious and the portions are huge I can guarantee you the general manager runs a spotless restaurant and if you'd like to have a drink they have a great cozy little bar and Denise and James are sure to take great care of you I recommend this place to all always a packed house here

Infamous place with lots of ambiance.  Casual to dressy attire with a creative and friendly waitstaff.  There are two sides to this establishment: one is the lounge that includes the fireside pit; and the other is the diner side.  Throughout the interior there's an array of neon lights, mirrors, plants, and steps.  

The portions are very large here and the prices do reflect the size.  Here is their menu http://www.usmenuguide.com/peppermill.html
The food is good but not great.  If you go here, it is for ambiance and to chill.

Fireside Lounge is awesome. We sat by the fire and shared the Scorpion with ice cream. Alright maybe a bit a girlie but I can see why this was rated one of the best make out bars in Vegas. We were here for about 10 minutes before we gave in and had to snuggle the night away.

Ahhh... The Peppermill and fireside lounge.  I think the Peppermill side is a bit like a Denny's restaurant but with better decor and slightly better food. I do however highly recommend checking out the fireside lounge. They have a pretty neat setup with a full bar and gaming and comfortable lounge style seating.  They also have a firepit with sofas surrounding it.  Very relaxing and nice to take a date or friends to share a "fishbowl" sized drink. 21 and over on the fireside section and only appetizers.  I always like to tell my friends "PM in the AM" as we seem to go to the Peppermill in the early mornings.

I regret Not going here in the 14 years i lived here before i left. It looked kinda divey on the outside in my eyes. But you cant be at the same location for as long as i remember with crappy food and service. Upon walking in i was impressed with the layout. It looks funky with neon lights and plush seating. The hostess was friendly upon entering. And once seated took our drink orders rather quickly. The prices werent bad at all. And the food portions OMG. Ate at around 3 and i didnt not eat again all night besides little snacks here and there. Plus they come around and take your pictures and you can buy it if you want. Sure why not did the touristy thing for once. I shall be back Peppermill. MUAH.

These people operate a tow truck scam, saw them tow two vehicles in less than 30 minutes. they have a flier taped to their door that says they're not involved, but it's their security guard who is calling the tow trucks. $300 to get your car out - why not focus on being a better restaurant, instead of scamming tourists?

Wow this place has that Miami Vice feel lol.  Came here after having one too many drinks, but it was to a point where I was enjoying myself here just fine.  

Our cab driver recommended this place to us since it was a 24hr. joint. We were seated in a round booth and it was really dim from what I could remember, but who wants to be in bright light when you're faded as heck?!? This place had a very chill ambiance and not too mention good food served in reasonable proportions!!! 

I would definitely recommend this restaurant/lounge.
Really amazing service- and great bloody mary's.  I really like the fireside lounge.  It is hot in there though, so be prepared :).  I'm so glad this iconic place is still open.  We had a great time.

I've been coming here since I was old enough to start visiting Vegas so this place has a lot of memories for me. (Sitting around the table with a bunch of friends at 4am digging into a MOUNTAIN of nachos.) 
     Now I only get to visit once a year, since I no longer live just a few hours from Vegas. Some visits have been better than others for sure, but I don't think I've ever walked out unhappy. This time I had the Mediterranean omelet ($14), which was good and the creme brulee ($7), which was OK.

The Good:
Not only was the omelet huge but more importantly it was good. There was plenty of pretty good quality shrimp and a fair dose of crab. The Hollandaise sauce was flavorful and complimented it well without taking away from the flavor of the shrimp and crab.

The Bad:
The only complaint, and it's not a severe one, is the waitress didn't do a very good job of keeping up with our drinks. It was just bad enough to be annoying, not bad enough to be frustrating.

The Indifferent:
The hash browns that came with the omelet were fairly unremarkable but I have to warn you, while I will eat them, I'm not a huge fan of hash browns so you might want to take my opinion on this with a little caution. 
     While I don't really expect much from creme brulee, I have had a couple that I really savored. This one wasn't in that category, while it was good enough it wasn't any better or worse than the average.
Very good food and huge portions-good for sharing. When we r in Vegas we always make a point to stop here. Come here when u are very hungry : )) Purple Rain colors inside decor...fun fun

A very weird vibe here, but the food is awesome and reasonably priced, and the quirkiness just adds to the Vegas charm.

I came in on a random weekday evening to grab a quick dinner. The first thing I noticed was the low, neon lighting everywhere. My attention quickly moved onto the skimpy retro style diner attire all the waitresses were wearing. It kind of gave off a bizzaro "Hooters" feel. On top of all that, I had arrived at 6 pm, apparently the tail-end of the early bird hour, as the median age of the clientele appeared to be approximately 82. Ah, Vegas. Where else can you see a retro neon hooters full of octogenarians?

Onto the food: I opted for the Philly cheesesteak with onion rings, and it was tasty, freshly prepared, and HUGE. I downed everything on the plate, but I had no regrets. My sense of accomplishment was only enhanced when I got the check. This place is a winner, folks.

After midnight mass on Christmas eve we went in bypassing the restaurant going into the lounge...and while looking around there was plenty of seating at 2am but it looked and felt so comfortable. The drinks were large and good! We enjoyed the time we spent there catching up on the comfy couches, watching the food come out to others sitting around the fire pool looking very YUMMY! Just had to go back after a show down that way and tonight got to eat!!! Wow it was YUMMY....The chilcken quesidilla was packed full with a garlic marinated chicken that was so tasty, the nachos were red and green for Christmas and just covered with cheese, all warm and gooey and  all the accompaniments on the side like salsa, beans and sour cream topped it. Then the pulled pork sliders....well need I say more??? Really enjoyed it all!

Wasn't my first choice, just became the most convenient option before beginning the long drive home.

Have to admit, I was quite pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food.  We had 2 sandwiches and both were huge portions (if anyone knows me, they know if I say they are huge...they are) and delicious.  we had a hot pastrami sandwich and a french dip with straight horseradish.  Home made onion rings and a delicious red potato salad completed the meal....wasn't exactly ready for a 5 hour drive after we finished...a nap would have been preferred...but i was due at work in 6 hours haha

Service was friendly and efficient refilling my coffee about a zillion times in preparation for the drive

I think I hyped this place up in my mind a bit too much, but it was still pretty good. I was really hungry from a long flight and Peppermill was a short walk north of our hotel. The 70s dinner theme was cute. There was a cocktail waitress taking drink orders at 10am, but the drinks took a really long time. Pretty good drinks, though. The highlight was the sugar shaker, which was full of sprinkles. Not your average sprinkles, either. They went really well with our pancakes. The food was good but not out-of-this-world. A good breakfast spot if you are staying north of the strip, but I wouldn't make it a destination. 


3.5 stars.

Visited June 2013

We picked this place based on yelp reviews and we must say that yelp reviewers did not lie!  First off all the decor. This restaurant has a special kind of eighties vibe, with the neon, flamingos and cool seating. Our hostess couldn't crack a smile, but fortunatley she was the exeption of the evening. Our waitress Daisy was very friendly and patient, the menu had a wide selection of different kinds of food and the cocktails were reasonable priced. We ordered salads, steak, shrimps and burgers. All of the food was cooked perfectly and incredibly tasty. The portion were generous. On small thing bothered us, but apparently it's an european thing: once a plate was empty, it was taken away from the table even when other people were still eating. This is considered rude in western europe. All and all we enjoyed our evening very much and would definitly return if we would be in vegas!

Upon walking up to, and into, this place, it was not what I expected.  I think I was expecting a steakhouse type of atmosphere, but it's more of a neon diner type of place.  It's technically on the strip, but definitely getting towards the sketchy end.  If you're looking for the "old Vegas" feel, definitely check this place out.  Once I kind of got past that, I thoroughly enjoyed myself.  And the nachos are out of this world. Service was - like everywhere I go in Vegas - excellent.

Cheers! and get the nachos with ground beef on the side - trust me !

Our family and friends from out of town visited the Peppermill for dinner.    The staff was very accommodating with our two young children.  We generally need to order food for the boys as soon as possible in order to have things not melt down and the staff addressed it in less than two minutes.  The menu is classic family restaurant fare.  Solid, cooked fresh, and good.  Nothing we had was outstanding but just solid good food.  The ambiance is classic 70s ultramod.     Definitely will visit again.

I saw the rumors that this place is closing and I weep for the future of Vegas.  I love love love this place.

Even though I'm a native of Seattle and have only been to Vegas 4 times, I've made it a point to stop at the Peppermill for late night grub and insanely strong drinks in the Fireside Lounge every single time I've visited since my 21st birthday (oh so many moon ago).

On my last trip to Vegas this past December I got to introduce a whole posse of Vegas virgins to the neon splendor and faux cherry tree glory that is the Peppermill.  

Vegas is not cheap anymore, Vegas is very hip now and gone are many of the old cheezy Vegas landmarks that us out-of-towners tend to associate with this fair city, except the Peppermill.  This place is the platonic ideal of Vegas and I hope it stays.

To echo some other reviews: insane portions to soak up alchohol? Check. Pretty hostesses? Check.  Unpretentious atomosphere? Check.  Strong drinks in a great setting? Check.  

Go while you still can before it turns in to some new mega resort that welcomes only the very rich and very beautiful.

Good spot.

Came in late night (is 3 am late in Vegas?) alone and sat at the "bar". I ordered a chocolate milkshake and it was delicious.

Wanted to write a review so I could mention the wonderful service I received, but since it was a month ago I completely forget her name. If management is reading this, she was 18-19 years old, just started college for dental school (she wanted to be a dentist).
She was probably the nicest server I've had in LV. Hopefully she reads this and gets a pat on the back (and a bonus).

This is hands down, the COOLEST lounge Ive ever been too. (not too sure about the Restaurant part) Its cozy, comfy, great for conversation with friends. The fire pit is really neat! the drink price is average.The only downfall is, like all the vegas casinos,  they let you smoke inside (yuck!) If your tired of walking up and down the strip and are trying to avoid all the crowded bars, this is the place to go! its a hidden gem.

I do love the PepperMill! I have to say on the last outing here the portion size of the salads has diminished quite a bit. My husband and I usually split a salad they are so big, but not this time.

I love this place, it is like an 80's throwback, lot's of glitz and glamour, and all the PerrpeMills I have ever been to are exactly the same. ((Bay Area included)). 

The fireside lounge is pretty cozy as well (same as it ever was) a bit of an icon, nothing like a froo froo drink and some appetizers in front of a fire (in Vegas the fire place is not really a requirement) but it makes you think it might be really cold outside (which in Vegas is rare).

If you are visiting Vegas, this is a restaurant you should visit, I mean it is on the strip, and the food is good, lot's on the menu, the people watching is fantastic (I love to people watch). Interesting folks here and the pricing is reasonable ((I did mention it is on the strip right?))

If you are looking for a great diner, this is it!  I have never had a bad meal there.  The only challenge, is making a decision.  Also you better come hungry as no one has ever left the Peppermill hungry.  I always bring folks here so that they can get a taste of old Vegas and some good food as well.

After reading mixed reviews, I decided I wanted to try this place out anyways.

Came here late last night with my boyfriend. The setup and decorations were pretty neat.

After opening my menu, all that ran through my mind was "Denny's food but double the price," so I expected the food to be good.. Or at least somewhat decent.. Wrong. We ordered the sampler to share, and neither one of us liked a single thing from the sampler, if you want cheaper and better diner food, go to Denny's or iHop.

Two stars because our server was very nice, and inside was cool. Food was not good at all.

This place has lots of character and some killer deserts. 
the food is a little better than Denny's but nothing amazing. But really you go here for the experience of old Vegas. Mirrors on the ceilings and trees inside whats not to love

Was in the mood for something "brunchy" on a Sunday morning. I was close by so I decided to drive over here. 

I ordered French toast, an order of sausage links, eggs and a Hawaii Sunset mimosa. 

Sooooooo much food....I ate it all though. The drink was pretty good too. The bill comes to around $30 with the drink and I gave the waitress a $5 for good service.

Would visit again...love old Vegas!

I'm extremely disappointed in my Wednesday breakfast spot The Peppermill if the news is correct concerning them asking a Muslim women to remove her head wrap or leave. Funny thing is; I always were a fitted ball cap when I'm there and usually have on Sunglasses. Just watched News 13 and I will never return. Now I am a Christian and Jesus ate with everyone. I'm not returning.

Good food with lots of variety and fast, friendly service.  This restaurant was a welcome relief from all the over-priced places on the Strip--so great to not have to sacrifice quality of good for an affordable price!

A Vegas classic still going strong. Form the good food at reasonable prices and the ambiance. Makes you feel like your in the past. This is a must try place if your looking for a little bit of old Vegas in a new Vegas time.
Always my favorite restaurant.  I've been coming here for 21 years.  Great bloody Mary's, food and ambience.  Good service.

THE Vegas diner experience. When it's 3am and looking for a Vegas-style late night dinner, this is the spot to go.

Neon? Check! Mirrors everywhere? Check! Free souvenir photo? Check!

Portions are huge and the menu is very extensive, and really, when you end up here at 3am, all the food will taste like Bobby Flay was in the kitchen.

Loved it!

Terrible service, nasty food, horrible atmosphere. We came inside and there were a few people waiting. I was told it would be about a ten minute wait "but probably shorter." After seeing many groups go ahead of us- including ones that arrived after us including a drunk loud mouth lady who said she had been waiting a while, cursed the host out, and got a table; I decided to find out what was going on. I looked at the list and saw my name up high with a bunch of crossed out names below mine. I was rudely told we had not been past over and would be next. 
I kept thinking "everyone raves about this place. The food better be damned good because their service surely sucked." Unfortunately, it wasn't. I ordered buffalo wing appetizers and they looked like they came straight out of a Sysco bag and into the deep fryer. The taste reminded me of something they may have fed us in grade-school. 
My entrée was shrimp scampi; half a dozen or so over-cooked shrimp in some oily sauce. The saving grace was the rice pilaf. Yes, it also looked like it was boiled, or microwaved in a bag, but it was not bad. 
The atmosphere - remember the drunk lady?  Well we were at the table right next to her and every sentence was "f this and f that, this persons an a-hole, f, f,f....." I would have said something but she was in a group of people including a large man wearing a "Tap Out" shirt who would have likely tied me into a pretzel and made me tap-out. 
To summarize: lousy service, pre-prepared food that you could make better yourself, and a loud terrible atmosphere. We will not be back and the people who raved about this place to me should have their head (and tastebuds) examined.

Mmmmmm, greasy American food!! We called ahead and made reservations, which was a little scattered. The person who answered the phone said they weren't accepting reservations, then she passed us off to someone who promptly asked for our name and number in our party. Glad we got on the list, because they were citing a 45-minute wait to walk-ins when we arrived!

The place was packed, and the vibe was loud but weirdly intimate in our booth. Perfect for a family trying to squeeze in a late dinner: our three boys under 5 years old were starting to meltdown a bit, but nobody noticed in this environment. Totally welcoming for groups of all sizes. Love that the servers didn't give us strange looks for coming in with a stroller. The prices were reasonable and the portions were big. I'd definitely come back with anyone, anytime.

Now that I have found you my lovely Peppermill... I will always visit when I'm in town!
One of the remaining vintage vegas landmarks, so please help this stay alive! We all know how much this town enjoy's getting rid of places. At first when you walk in the neon is confusing... strip club? restaurant? family friendly? bar? 
I agree with most, the atmosphere is instantly fun, and because they add the extra bonus of taking group photos of your table (for free), that makes it better. The food is all american, diner, and easily shareable, and affordable! Great for all ages, and big or small groups.
The lounge has several alcove booths as well as a hot tub looking fire pit at the entrance!

The scenery is peerless, neon-laced '70s kitsch. My enormo tomato-hollandaise chicken omelet didn't live up to its promise and the hash-browns were strangely subpar. Coffee: decent. Our waitress was stoned and the prices were a bit high too. Still, the convenience- (nice to be able to park right next to a decent eats on the strip) and cheese-factor make this a Vegas must.

Peppermill brings my imagination back to the time where Vegas was ruled by the mob and Ol' Blue Eyes made all the ladies swoon with his velvet voice. Neon Lights and plush decor followed by a tree in the middle of the dining area, only in Vegas baby!

Our first stop was this place straight from the airport. My friend went for the usual - scrambled eggs, sausage and home fries. I've never had it so I tried the southern fried steak and eggs. All I can say is that it's perfect drunk food. Filling, heavy and the steak looked like mystery meat lol. Huge portions. 

Great diner that's open 24/7. Oh and I saw Paul Pierce here.

WELL KISS MY GRITS!

I have lived in Las Vegas for just over ten years now. Finally I have made it to the Peppermill. Service was a little disappointing, but not so bad to kill this review. My wife and I went on a Friday close to 11:20am. We were told it would be about 20-25 minutes until a table was ready; we were invited to wait inside the Fireside Lounge.

My wife and I don't drink but LOVED the atmosphere in the Fireside Lounge. We literally sat fireside, watching the atmosphere, looking over the menu, this is where I discovered that Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis had dined at The Peppermill. Personally I think that's cool. As if it were on cue, our table was ready in 20-25 minutes.

As we sat, at our booth, Hope you like booth seating. Unless you are at bar we will be seated in a booth! Our server arrived soon after. We were overlooking the menu still as the waitress took our drink orders. When she returned we still needed time to decide. Our waitress said "I'll be back" as if our not ordering yet was an inconvenience for her. 

The food was fine. Typical diner like fare. We had mozzarella sticks as an appetizer. I ate a  Philly Cheese Steak, Savory u.s.d.a. choice beef strips flash - sautéed with strips of onion, bell peppers, sliced tomato and smothered with provolone on a grilled steak roll. My wife ate what was called, Conquest, Combination of roast beef, cheddar cheese, tomato, sautéed peppers, onions, mushrooms, thousand island dressing and bacon, served on grilled parmesan sourdough. The meal reminded me a lot of eating at a diner like Denny's. When I mentioned this to my wife she fully agreed. 

As we were eating, a lady with camera walked by and asked if we would like to pose for a souvenir picture. We agreed.The lady with camera said she would return as soon as we were done with out meals. But alas she never returned.
The meal was all but over. My plate was empty; my wife still had a few onion rings on her plate. Our waitress came by and asked how we enjoyed our meals. As we were answering, she took the plates, without asking if my wife wanted those remaining onion rings.

WELL KISS MY GRITS!

As we were leaving we walked right by that lady with a camera, who never returned to take out picture.

The ambiance alone for this restaurant is a total win. Located near the more classic parts off the strip like Circus Circus and the late Stardust. The waitresses and cocktail waitress are dressed up in true diner style. The menu had a wide variety of food and from the things that my party ordered, all of it was delicious. The mushroom dish that came with the steak was phenomenal. 

The Peppermill also has incredibly large portions for the price you pay. If you ask for a side of fries, its in a huge bowl instead of a small plate. Although I did not drink any other their drinks they had a huge drink menu that looked great and all of them came with a scoop of real ice cream. I will have to try it the next time.

I went here and gambled for the first time ever.  Here is a lesson about gambling.  You start off betting 25 cents on video poker and you stick a dollar in the slot so you can play 4 times.  You always get dealt 15 or 16 which is super boring, what do you do?  Hit and probbaly bust or not hit and probably definitely lose?  Anyway at some point you'll realize that if you bet 50 cents you can win more if you actually win and get up to $3.50.  Then you get cocky and bet a dollar twice and your money is gone.

Anyway I liked the Fireside Lunge.  There is a fountain in there with a real fire coming out of the middle of the water, you can sit around it and watch the TV screens which are plentiful and playing football, basketball (hoops) and some music videos, good ones like 80s and Roy Orbison.  That puts you in a good mood.  The lights are really bright blue and red.  Neon, with reflective surfaces and free nuts.  I had an "Amstel Light" for $5.50 which was depressing, lost $2 gambling and left.  But no one bothered me and you could just waste a lot of time in there I think.  The bartender was REALLY NICE and there are all these fancy dressed up waitresses with their ass and titties hangin' out all over the place.  A good first stop.  Across the street you can get a souvenir  or go McDonalds or do "indoor skydiving" and for all of these reasons, overall I would recommend the Peppermill Restaurant, specifically the fireside lounge.  Make sure you are not wearing your gang colors or a ripped shirt though!!!

Very "Vegas". Was not a huge fan of the atmosphere. I felt like everything was really dirty and of course, being in a restaurant, that would freak most people out. The water tasted weird and the food was alright. I've had better. This place is more nostalgic than anything.

We went here for breakfast on 27-Dec 2011 and were greeted by a loooong queue. That's always a good sign - a place has to be good if there are so many people willing to wait for the first meal of the day! Fortunately, there were a couple of seats available at the counter, and we asked the hostess if there was a queue for that. Nope!! So we just walked straight in and it was the most awesome feeling in the world - jumping a queue of about 30. Haha

Anyways, on to the food. GIANT portion sizes. I am a ravenous beast in the morning, and I could only make through half of my Marco Pollo Omelet and the monster portion of hash browns. My husband ordered the french toast, and got 3 (or was it 4?) huge slices with a mound of fruit on top. The food was not uniquely delicious, but it was satisfying. All in all, we left happy and content.

We will definitely return whenever we visit the sin city next!

The hubby and I were looking for a good, filling breakfast before hitting the casinos for the day, and we found The Peppermill. YUM! The decor was hilarious in itself. i could almost imagine I was on a movie or 70s TV set! The clientele on this morning was varied and several were obviously "working girls" winding down from the previous night. 

My French Toast platter and his omlette were both delicious and filling. Service was quick, attentive and friendly. We will definitely make this a stop for future Vegas trips!

I don't give 5stars easily. This place was SO good!! My husband and I shared the fruit fantasia waffle & munch's breakfast. So delicious!! The waffle was covered in fresh fruit and came with a delicious sauce that wasn't too sweet. Munch's was equally as good. Totally recommend this place & worth the wait!!
I love this little dive place! I wish they had more than one firepit but - the overall vibe is low-key and chill. This is a must, gets you away from the Strip - good drinks!

Just because it's a legend, that doesn't mean it's still the best.  In fact, this place has dropped off my list of places to eat. Look at the area around the Peppermill. The Clarion was once the Debbie Reynolds, WWF, Paddle wheel casinos. Now,  it's rubble. Tacos Del gordo was THE PLACE for an arm-sized burrito and super fresh tacos. Now it's an empty store. Further proving that the SLS Is dead wrong by telling us that "North is the new South ". (that's a truly a DUMB idea. As is the idea of the SLS itself.  Enjoy it now,  I say it's closed by '19) Next month another classic is done. The Riviera sadly closes.  The landscape changes again. Between the quality going down, prices going the other direction and the fact that some of the local residents of the 4-legged variety have been seen nearby.  I wouldn't send anyone to go there.  I used to LOVE the open hearth of the Fireside.  But I have to admit,  I'll never go again.
Big portions 10 egg omelets great prices long wait times arrive early. Would come back again!! Lots of options good kids menu.

The Hubs and I went for breakfast this past Saturday morning for breakfast. The wait was about 30 minutes which was just fine for us because it allowed us to go to the bar for a Bloody Mary. The Bloody Mary's were very good and the bar is fun and eclectic.
We were seated in a booth in the middle of the restraunt and that made for some good people watching. Our server was prompt and friendly in taking our order and bringing water. There is a cocktail server walking around taking for your cocktail order. The menu had a lot of choices for breakfast,lunch and dinner. Food was good and atmosphere was fun and swanky. If you like fun and funky I recommend the Peppermill.

I've eaten here more than once over the years, and can say it has great food and a wonderful aubience.

The Fireside Lounge is a very romantic and relaxing place to kick back and sip on drinks.

Love their Irish Coffee.

WOO-HOO, what a place.  I felt like I was on Miami Vice.  Very 80's and very neon, however the food was really good.
My friend who is from Vegas never heard of it, and when we got there he asked how did you find out about this.....I said it was on an HBO Show several times in the season.  
I had an Tostada omelette.  I didn't realize they are 10 egg omelettes. It came with a mound of hash browns and a bagel.  I couldn't eat it all, and my friend had Eggs Benedict.  I sampled and the  Hollandaise was exceptional.  The price was really affordable and you can see that the place is really loved by the locals.

A nice throw back to old vegas, with the mirrors neon lights and 'fire pit' tables.  
It's not associated with any casinos and while there are a few slots it's a pretty quiet spot open 24/7

The menu is large and the portions are huge, well worth the walk up the north strip (though maybe not at high noon on a 110 degree day - I almost died)

Get there between 3-6 and have at their insane food and drink specials in the lounge.

Boom! All the changes in Vegas over the years ( remember Sahara, Stardust,Aladdin...be careful circus circus you may be next) and this place has remained the quintessential go to spot for 3AM, 4AM breakfast. Food is always good , but lets face it, at 3,4,5 AM do you reeeealy care about how breakfast tastes? You're just glad you are eating something ...a grilled rat from the construction site next door would do. This is THE spot to go for 
b-fast after a long night of clubbing, gambling and debauchery. Wish they had rental beds to sleep off the meals. Don't ever go away big P!!!!
Large portions. Solid value. Fun, vibrant atmosphere. Great for business meetings, morning-after hangover cures and fireside chats with a date. It's right on the Strip so expect a lot of tourists.

Looks sketchy on the outside, but the food is decent (huge portions).  Margaritas were sub par. Decor inside is cheesy but a treat!  We ate there as soon as we checked into our hotel, and again before we took off to the airport.

It's silly, but good.
My boyfriend and I came here for breakfast and all I can say is... AMAZING!!! Definitely will be back on my next Vegas trip or maybe tomorrow

There were three of us for dinner (after getting snubbed at Phil's Italian Steakhouse inside Treasure Island).

The restaurant side was bright and fun. As we were three big guys, we ate at the cafe` bar. We didn't want to try squeezing into a booth. The server was friendly, fun, and knowledgeable about all the food. She even brought out one of the cooks to answer a question from the 'caveman diva' of our group (no, that was not me). 

My NY strip steak was really good. The shrimp scampi was okay (which is the reason they didn't get five stars). The meatball soup was great! Probably because it tasted very similar to the version I make at home. The other two people in my group also thought the food was good...including the caveman. The menu selection is huge! As much as I wanted dessert, I declined as I was stuffed.

We ate on the restaurant side and I plan to go back to visit the lounge side. 

I would definitely come back here again!
Vegas classic, you must hit up the Fireside Lounge in the back (to the left of the entrance past the restrooms).  The neon trees and the ballgowns are epic!
One of the best diners in Vegas. Never had a bad drink or meal here. Plus the atmosphere is really inviting.

This place is so good. The portions are so huge, especially the pancakes and ham. I have always had good service and food. I have never had to return my plate for any reason. They have been consistently good. The bloody mary's are so good, one of the best in Vegas.

I still love this place, and will continue to bring visiting guests here, but this particular visit was less than stellar.  

We came at 1:00...my first time for lunch, and they were packed.  We had to be put on a waiting list, but it only took about 5 minutes to seat us. However, after being seated, it took them at least 10 minutes to even come ask for our drinks...well, non-alcoholic...the cocktail waitress was right there. Gotta love Vegas. 

Anyway, I ordered the Conquest (no onions of course) at the waitresses' suggestion and it was just mediocre. The roast beef was bland and the sandwich needed more sauce. The bread was good though. Fries were ok, but a little greasy.  The ice tea was good. 

Next time I will just go with my own choice. LOL!

Had been so looking forward to trying this place and was really disappointing.

This place is always so busy when we visit Vegas. Most of the time there is a 30 minute wait so we just find somewhere else to go. We finally managed to get a table without having to wait and were expecting to be blown away with the food, but it was very mediocre.
  
Plus points - portions are good, atmosphere was nice

Negative points - food was very mediocre, prices are high for the quality of food

With Vegas having so many awesome restaurants I cant see myself spending my money here ever again.

What don't I love about this place. The decor looks like you stepped into Elton John's living room (as if I know..haha). Every time I've eaten there the waitress's have always been very attentive, Oh and they aren't bad looking. The prices may seem a little high at first, but when you see the portion sizes, the prices are reasonable.

If Denny's had a baby with a unicorn and a strip club, it would be The Peppermill Restaurant.  You're greeted with pink, purple, and blue neon lighting with matching diner-style booths. Faux greenery including cherry blossom trees and tons of flowers give a psychedelic garden feel.  The multicolored table sugar was a fun touch.

We were seated promptly and service was great from our waitress and our cocktail waitress.

House chardonnay was decent (happy hour half price makes it taste better).  The gyro meat was straight from a restaurant supply house, but it satisfied my hankering for some lamb. Curly and regular fries were nice and crispy.  We also shared a banana split which came complete with chocolate syrup, peanuts, and cherries.  Again, nothing special but it was exactly what you picture when you think of a banana split.  A couple of girls sitting nearby took a selfie (or two or three or 500) with their Bloody Marys.  They looked like classic Marys with a celery and cucumber garnish.

They're not reinventing the wheel here, but they have solid versions of classic food with a really fun atmosphere ripe for people watching.

Oh and the restrooms were very clean and their soap smelled good. (I had a couple wines.)

I've never been here until my boyfriend took me here for my 21st birthday. The place is pretty big. Once you walk into this place, the restaurant is to your right and the bar lounge is to your left, just gotta walk through the doors. I love the theme. I can't really put my finger on what it is but it's nice. 

The ladies dress in cute dresses walking around in the bar/lounge area. And their most famous thing in the bar/lounge area is of course the fire pit. Oh, and I suggest everybody to try the Scorpion. It's good.

The restaurant serves huge portions of food. A group of 3 or 4 people could order just their nachos and share the whole thing. All of their food is good. 

Oh and just so I don't forget they have a photographer walking around taking pictures at every table at the restaurant and the bar/lounge area.

This is my favorite coffee shop in Vegas. Open 24 hours, they're at the North end of the strip, by the Riviera. You never know who you will run into in this place. Stars, athletes, pimps...everybody in Vegas finds their way into The PepperMill sooner or later. They make great Omelets, and awesome Bloody Mary's for those early breakfasts when you're not quite done partying. The place is done in purple neon, like it's 1970, but it's not run down--just stuck in time.  It's clean, the food is fresh, and the portions are huge. This is the can't miss it 3am breakfast destination. Love this place!
Great Breakfast / Brunch spot!  Lots of tasty options and I love the neon and decor!

When I asked the driver to take us to a place near the LV Convention Center for breakfast, I naturally assumed he'd drop us off at the nearest Denny's. Instead, he brought us to Peppermill, a throwback diner with a strip club feel. When we walked in, I couldn't decide if I was looking at a scene from National Lampoon's Vegas Vacation or a Tarantino film.

The décor was straight from the 70s with fake hanging plants and booths wrapped in hot pink and blue neon lights (hence the strip club feel).  The patrons were equally colorful on a weekday morning.

The food was good old Americana. Huge portions and decent prices. $11.50 for 3 eggs, 3 big sausage links, really crispy tasty hash browns, and toast. Coffee mugs were latte size, so you didn't have to wait around for a refill (a plus if you're a caffeine addict like me) which was good because although the server was friendly, she rarely stopped to check on us. Our table was the only table that didn't have regular sugar packets, which we didn't notice that until AFTER we used what we assumed was sugar from the container on the table. It was sugary (red, white, blue pellets) and left a candy like floaties in my coffee. I kept waiting for the hallucinations to start, but ultimately no harm done. 

Overall, it's nothing spectacular, but I love finding new spots and taking in the local color (neon and all). Worth a stop if you're hungry and  on that end of the strip.
Great atmosphere, the best place for a date night,  good service and affordable prices. They will definitely have my business again.
I had fun at the fireside lounge. We had a little bachelorette get together and it had a nice vintage vibe and even had a photographer going around and taking photos. Good times!

vegas makes me do crazzzzzy things..

like driving to vegas at 3:00pm on a school night with a girlfriend
like over stuffing myself with five plates of food at the buffet
like meeting some random girls in a bathroom and ending up on a vip list to tao
like unconsciously finding myself seated in a restaurant filled with bright funky (bright neon pink) colors, plastic-covered booths, tacky lights and beads at 4:30 am
like ordering myself a peppermill omelet with turkey breat, cheese, and hollandaise sauce at 4:30am and clearing the plate with no shame
like leaving vegas at 5am to head home just in time for work

this place is a tacky but friendly old-vegas 24hr eatery open to in-town and out-of-town drunkards, hookers, and vegas goers.
Had lunch here early today... One of the best burgers I've had in a loooooooong time!!!
AWESOME food, people, and environment! They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner 24 hours a day! The portions are HUGE and the food is amazing!

The Peppermill is my must-go restaurant every time I'm in Vegas. It's got that old school Las Vegas diner feel, excellent service, and huge, hangover-curing portions.

I absolutely love the decor. It's not modem by any means but it's got charm and I wouldn't change a thing.

Do you want your racism straight up or on the rocks?
Over the phone, a Peppermill manager said this policy is only in place on the Strip and only in the Fireside Lounge. They've stood by it for 10 years, saying they've asked other Muslim women to take off their head coverings, and asked people of the Jewish faith to remove their yarmulkes.
This is the place to go for a meal when you've had enough of the casinos.  Old school diner vibe, but with a splash of Vegas flash.  The food's decent as well.

I first tried this place after leaving the club drunk and hungry I asked my cab driver what was a really good place for us to go and eat and based on his recommendation we ended up here. 

 I had seen this place many times before when in vegas and I decided to give it a try. The ambiance of this restaurant is actually pretty cool the neon lights late at night make it seem really cool inside and out. The staff was very friendly and suggestive as to what type of burger I should get let's just say I wasn't disappointed all the food was really good. Moderate price range. Cab service right outside when you need it. In short, I enjoyed my experience here!

Classic. Old School Vegas Gem.

Great food and service.  The Lounge by the fire is one of the best places to hang out and drink with your friends.  We spent "Super Bowl Saturday" here.  We relaxed in a big booth by the fire and enjoyed specialty cocktails way into the night.  Then went and rested up for the Big Game in 2004.  Fun times with good friends are where memories are made. 10 years later and I still remember the time....

 Love this place~

This place is what I refer to as HOT & Alot.
Portions are huge. Service was good and friendly but the food is not good. Its a step up from Denny's. At least Denny's is cheap.

So,  i believe that the bartender is new. Michael . very personable and engaging! Payed very close attention to my drinks.

I will definitely return
Their service is extremely slow. Their food isn't worth the wait. Their portions are ginormous which is the only positive aspect of this restaurant.

cool old vegas decor and a bunch of half dressed women there. thats where the positive ends. other than that thx for the heartburn and the non existent service. ive never not tipped before. thanks for being my first
Food is good....I give that 4 stars.....Our Server....What a BAD ATTITUDE! !!!  One Star is Generous.

Came here for the first time about 3 weeks ago. Read about the place and heard how good the food was so I was excited to try it. I can tell you without a doubt I was beyond satisfied. Simply put - the food was SO GOOD! It was crowded but the wait time to get a table was not bad. The portions of food were large and omg it was just so good. I wish there was one here in L.A.! You seriously have to try this place if you are in Vegas. Simply fantastic!

Had to take our out of town family to this legendary place,  but the food was only mediocre. I'm  pretty sure the eggs were powdered. The service was also mediocre, but it was super busy as it was Easter morning. This is one of those places you take people just so they get a chance to see it and say they've been there, but it's not really the place to go if youre looking for a high quality breakfast.
Very cool diner and lounge.  Lounge is very cozy and has a huge fireplace to sit around.  Always good service, always good food, always a good time.  A Vegas legend.
Order the scorpion on the rocks or with ice cream. You wont be sorry. Don't forget to go back to the Fireside Lounge for an after breakfast cocktail.

What a great place to just hang out, relax with friends and people watch, a real throwback type place, lots of neon and mirrors, so tacky but done in a way that actually doesn't make it seem tacky.

For some reason I think the place used to be darker, with the higher level of lighting it has lost a little bit of the "secret hideaway" atmosphere, but heck I like it and it isn't far to walk to get some good food.
i go here often when I go to Vegas haha I dont know why but i do. Food isnt that bad and service is nice. I usually always get the same which is the bacon cheese burger.

My friends and I ate here 3 times in our 5 days in Vegas. The food was delicious and the location is very convenient if you are staying at the Encore/Wynn or some of the other hotels at the end of the strip. 

I had the chicken strips twice and buffalo chicken wrap. Both very tasty! My friends really enjoyed the breakfast, wings, salads as well. Service was alright.

The only thing I didn't like is they have cocktail waitresses who bring alcohol rather than your waiter. The first night we went, we had no problems getting drinks. However, the last day, our waitress kept saying she would send the cocktail waitress but she never came. She finally came when we were almost done with our meal but wasn't really worth it to get a drink then. Not sure if that's always a problem, but it's just a bit odd.

The Eggs Bene were fantastic and the hash browns look nondescript until you taste them. Instead of being cut julienne style they are shave thin. OMG, nice and crispy on the outside and moist on the inside. The country style ham and eggs would feed any army. And to top it off you have full bar service.

Huge portions, good service (in skimpy outfits), and the basics (eggs and hash browns) are decidedly better than Denny's. Certainly gaudy, but isn't that the point?

Unlike other reviewers, we didn't experience excessive endearments from our server, though she was from the South.

Try feta cheese & vegetable or asparagus omelet here.  The hash browns are crispy and one of the best I've tasted. Fast service, people watching late night is entertaining, be sure to check out the lounge. It's a Vegas experience worth checking out if you are visiting town. I recommend.

Awesome spot. This is where we go to breakfast every morning when we're in town. The maserati omelet is the best. They serve a lot of food. My wife and I are able to split a plate and still full. The pancakes are worth a shot too.

Eating at the Peppermill has become a tradition for us every time we're in town. Open 24/7, it exemplifies the glitz and glamour of the old Vegas--garish and all. With everything from the neon lights to the boldly colorful booths and the fluorescent table sugar, this place will make you feel like you've arrived in the city and gone back in time.

Not to mention, it's also one of the best deals on the Strip. For $13.50 you get a lot of food. I'm partial to the omelets, which are huge and come with a hefty portion of hash browns and toast/muffins. My two favorites are the Maserati and the Marco Pollo. 

The hash browns are thicker than any I've ever had. It actually feels like I'm eating pure potatoes--not overly buttered ones.

This place has the classic diner feel, but better food and heartier portions. It's pretty packed, even in the graveyard hours. And every once in awhile you'll catch a famous face sitting at one of the booths.

I definitely recommend the Peppermill for anyone who wants to get that iconic Vegas feel when coming into town.

The breakfast was delicious! The ambiance is perfect for the breakfast/brunch time. The waiting is pretty long but the lounge through the double doors is perfect for waiting and having awesome large drinks! The price is very reasonable for the amount of food. The three star is for the waiting time, the 2 only bathrooms in the womens restrooms and my always hit or miss, the coffee. The coffe was terrible and yes this is Vegas and usually everyone has a drink, but I'd like a good cup of coffee once in while during my Vegas trips. Otherwise, great area, lots of parking and good service!

I've been here twice now, and there are definitely dishes here that are better than others.  I'm vegetarian, so I'm limited to begin with; and I'm kind of a health nut, so that limits me further.  If you're at all like me, avoid the egg dishes with the hash browns; in my opinion, there wasn't enough taste to compensate for how much oil/butter/fat was clearly used.  On the other hand, the waffles with fruit are SO GOOD.  I haven't tried the pancakes, but plan to next time I'm there.  I haven't tried any of the dinner options (not many options there for vegetarians), but if you like having breakfast anytime, this place is open 24/7 and serves breakfast items all day and all night.  It's a handy place to come if it's midnight and you're starving!

The cool atmosphere is why you come here, essentially.  The food by itself isn't mind-blowing, but it has a cool vibe - and conveniently is open 24/7, for your round-the-clock eating needs.  I live here in Vegas, so I'm sure I'll be back many times in the future.

Wow! I wish I could give 10 stars!  Don't let the outside fool you.  It looks like a Spires type restaurant outside. Nothing special.  But inside is amazing! The decor is old school 70's disco style but very nice.  Check out the lounge too. Coolest ambiance ever! Fire & water pit to relax around. 

Now to get to the service. OMG! Can't get better. Period.  Went for breakfast but they serve their whole menu all day. Greeted right away by friendly host. Sat and served coffee immediately.  Cocktail waitress frequented a couple times to make sure we didn't want anything. Friendly not pushy. Waitress was friendly and very attentive. Filled drinks right away.  Noticed without asking that we were out of regular sugar packs. My eggs were waaay over runny and I had to send them back.  She was very apologetic.  The manager brought my eggs back perfect and also apologized.  She said she personally sent them back twice for me because they cooks didn't get them right to get liking. Wow. Judy wow. That is personal attention.
Speaking of food,  our was great.  My meal was super simple (eggs, sausage & hash browns). Was good.  Hash browns are ribbon style and fresh. But my hubby ordered chicken fried steak. It was really, really good! Huge and cooked perfectly.  Not chewy. Yummy gravy that tasted like sausage. The portions are enormous!  Easily shareable. 3 eggs come with most dishes.
Can't wait to come again! They have an awesome team!

What can't I say about the Peppermill.  Old school Vegas!!
Great environment, nice seating and bar area for a date night out.  Good food (not excellent or would get a 5 star), excellent service and amazing desert options (try the sundaes).
Diner food is the main staple in the dining room and extremely unique drink options in the bar with the cool, blue fire pit INSIDE.
Take a moment to visit this classic Vegas location in between Wynn and SLS on the east side of the strip.  You won't regret it!
I have been coming here for 20+ years. Always great bloody Mary's and consistent food. Enjoy!

For the past 15 years, every trip I make to Vegas (and there have been many) I always stop in Peppermill Lounge for a drink. Maybe it's nostalgia - not sure, but I love this place. 

The lounge has firesides, usually cheesy music videos on the TV, pretty girls in long black dresses and stiff drinks. 

Breakfast at 4 am or drinks at 2pm - I enjoy the Peppermill and it's definitely always a part of my Vegas itinerary.

I make it a point to stop here on every Vegas trip.  Why?  Too die for oven-fresh blueberry muffins.  And it's nice to know that as Vegas changes every year (since I've made Vegas an annual trip at a minimum, I've seen one hotel go every year - Stardust, Frontier, etc.) and continues to become more upscale, the Peppermill (hopefully) will always be around whenever I visit.

Came for breakfast during world of concrete.
We waited for 30 minutes to get seated and that was the only downside.
Service was awesome.  Food was awesome.
Try the pancakes.  They are about 10" diameter.
The parfait is my go to for hangovers.
For a more Vegas experience, come in around 5am and watch the "end of shift activities".

We came here for a good inexpensive breakfast & that is exactly what we got. They have big portions. So sharing is good if u don't want to be stuffed. We had the cheese omelette w/hash browns & a pancake. It was all great, the hash browns are outstanding, taste homemade. The pancake is enormous, light & fluffy but thick @ the same time. All in all a good breakfast @ a great price.
Great food at any hour!  Classic Vegas decor!  Love their breakfast and appetizer options.  Check out the lounge too!

I like the old school interior and their table sugar!
Generous potion, Good Food.
The wait can be so long at rush hour.
Always delicious! Large portions and such a cool ambiance. This is one of my favorite eateries in Vegas.

This is the place to go back in time in Las Vegas. We went on a Thursday night around 10:30-11:30pm. There were plenty of large booths to choose from.  I like that the servers are dressed in long, black gowns. It feels like vintage sexiness. The entire place is vintage -from the orange upholstered banquettes to the sunken fire pit. Each booth feels private, and since this place is kind of surreal in a back-in-time way, I could imagine that a couple looking to spice things up could start a night of sexiness at this smoky-mirrored mecca. Note - this place is not for those who like new, modern, high-end things. You will not find the Peppermill sexy if you don't like a little grittiness. If you're fancy and like new, sparkly things, check out the Chandelier Lounge in the Cosmopolitan instead.

Interesting place on the strip! I was surprised at how clean it was! We went for Sunday morning breakfast and really enjoyed it! The eggs are nice and fluffy and the homefries are awesome! Juicy blueberry muffin, unlike no other in Vegas! Must try if you live in town or just visiting!

Food is typical diner food. However, the staff is excellent. Not to sound superficial or anything but it seems like they have unbelievably pretty waitresses working there, and lots of them. It makes for a nice atmosphere. The ambiance in diner dining is the best here.
My wife and I ate here every morning we were in Las Vegas. Be aware, their omelets are made from 7-10 eggs. If you get one, plan to share! Excellent food, pleasent atmosphere (themed).

Good food if you're very hungry. Portions are huge. The ambience and decor are old and reminded me of an 80s movie. Nothing exceptional to brag about but does but the spot if you're looking a good quick bite.

50s style diner with comfort food 24/7. Thankfully they have turkey sausage and oatmeal for the more health conscious. Prepare to wait. Don't leave w/o seeing fire pit TV and lowered lounge. Classic Vegas.

I totally LOVE this place! The art deco flamingo lampshades gaudily clash with the mirror mosaic ceiling tiles, pink and purple neon lights and purple and turquoise seats (are they made of velour?!). There are fake trees and plants. The waitresses are dressed in brightly colored short dresses. What is not to love? The menu is varied with many breakfast or dinner choices. My southern fried steak was the best I can remember having. Ever. And I'm from TX. 

We went with friends for brunch on a Sunday. Call ahead for a table if you don't want to wait. I'm glad I did so. I would love to go there as a last call stop after a night out on the Strip...it's gotta be an interesting place in the wee small hours if it was interesting on a late Sunday morning. 

This is now going to be one of our this-is-Vegas spots for when people come to visit. 

Love it! :)

Big portions. Lots of choices on the menu. Decent value too. Breakfast served all day. Beers are 5.50 or do , so not cheap especially compared to casinos. The neon lights does give a bit of strip club atmosphere but its bright enough to see and eat and it's actually a cool atmosphere.
 
 Only downside was the leather booths made my butt sweat! And some of the booths make for oddly arranged seating.

Great food. Nice service. Make sure you go very hungry, because besides being good food, is massive. Specially the omelets. 
The decor looks like a strip club, but it didn't bother me, made me feel at home.
Enjoy a refreshing bloody mary while you wait to have breakfast! Pancakes, eggs, sausage and hash browns were great! Recommend to add to your morning while visiting vegas.

I'll start by saying the server, Nellie, was wonderful. The food was very well made as well. Unfortunately, due to the unprofessional and extremely rude attitude of the manager on duty at the time, Peggy, I have to give this establishment 1 star.

While in the restroom, a male employee opened the door and said "Lady, I have to clean"  and added something along the lines of telling me to hurry up. 

I went up to the host podium and politely asked to speak with a manager. Peggy said that she was the manager, so I told her that I appreciate the fact that they keep their restroom cleans for their guests. However, having a male employee open the door and ask you to hurry up is unsettling and was an unpleasant experience. 

Peggy then proceeded to tell me that he couldn't have said that to me because, "he doesn't even speak English". I responded by stating he knew enough to stay that. I can excuse the way he said that, knowing that there was in fact a language barrier. That's fine, I am not saying anything poor in regards to his work ethic. It's hard to work somewhere where the predominant language is not your own. 

However, to be told he didn't say that to me, is condescending, unprofessional and rude. A manager should never speak that way to a guest and they definitely should not end the conversation, which was civil (I wasn't yelling or making a scene, I was simply telling her it was an off putting encounter), by then walking away without another word. 

It wasn't busy. At that time, there was only one couple waiting to be seated. If I was the owner, this woman would never be representing their establishment. Such an unfortunate situation because everything else from the food to the decor was lovely.

I haven't been to the Peppermill in 20 years.  We stopped there a few times when we were tourists.  I decided to go today for a different breakfast place.

I arrived about 9:45 and the place was packed.  There was a waiting list for a table, but the counter was open so I went there.  Angela was my server and she immediately got me some coffee.  I have read about the big portions.  It starts with their over-sized coffee mugs.  Very nice.

I ordered the Fruit fantasia waffle, a good sized waffle topped with seasonal fresh fruit and served with boysenberry syrup and butter and whipped cream or sour cream for a topping.  The waffle had a lot of fruit--bananas, grapes, honeydew melon, cantaloupe, and strawberries.  It was excellent.

This is an institution that has been around for a lot of years and based on the people there today, it will be around for a lot more.

Pretty great place! My wife and I went here twice for breakfast while we were in Las Vegas. Outstanding food and cocktails. Mazerati omelet was awesome! Second day had the Pastrami burger. Also amazing. We wanted to come back to the lounge later but we had so much planned, we didn't have much time. Only thing is that the service was a bit slow on the second day when we sat at the breakfast bar. Otherwise, awesome!

This was the first time we tried this old time establishment. The wait was a quick 5 minutes and service was good. I tried the crab cake Benedict for breakfast and it was quite delicious! The two generously sized crab cakes topped the English muffins and were smothered in a nice hollandaise sauce and topped w two perfectly cooked poached eggs. It came with a large side of nicely crisped hashbrowns. The serving was normal-large for a bene but my husband's (delicious) country fried steak and my niece's pancake combo were huge!

My hubby absolutely loves this place. He lived in Vegas for years and had never been! Their breakfast was good so we came back to try it for dinner. Not bad! It seems to be pretty packed constantly but the wait for two people isn't bad if you're open to sitting at the bar. The day time and night time waitresses wear different outfits and it's all very "Alice in Wonderland" (I'm assuming that's what they're going for). All in all pretty cool with a good group of staff that gets things out decently quick. They have different servers for food and alcohol though which was weird (who wants to tip twice in a meal...?) but we definitely liked it.
Great food!! Great service!! Don't be offended by the neon lights... It's Vegas Darlin'!!

I love this place! We have been here every time that we have been to Vegas. It is open for 24hrs, and you can get breakfast anytime! The decor is so kitchy and kooky it is just entertaining in itself. The walls and ceilings are covered with mirrors, there is a lot of pink neon happening and there are these big fake cherry trees. They also have a great lounge complete with an indoor fire pit. Their food is typical diner fair, but amped up a bit. Unless you are really hungry and can put away some serious food, splitting an entree is probably just fine. They have got great Reubens, burgers and breakfast. My husband had the California omlette that was so big, he ate half, then we both split the other half for breakfast the next morning. They also have your basic cocktail menu, that you order from your cocktail waitress. This has become a must when we go to Vegas!

Great spot to eat after partying. The portions are huge and you can't really go wrong with anything you order! Breakfast for dinner. I think so! The only bad thing was that their system was down so everything had to be done manually and the girls didn't know how. Besides that, the experience was great!

Oh so wanted a benny for breakfast and after reading the reviews and seeing the photos I decided to walk a mile and half to this place for breakfast. It's really cool and the waitstaff is super friendly. I felt like I had been time warped to a Vegas way before I was born and have expected to see a hung over Elvis dining there. The food was good and with the prices so outrageous on the strip this was more affordable. My benny wasn't the best I have ever had but I enjoyed the moment in a funky environment. The service was fantastic-and I wondered how is the waitress so perky this morning- I had too many champagne cocktails at Absinthe and Fizz the night before. Viva Las Vegas!
Awesome lounge, very creative menu. With a cool atmosphere and great tasting drinks. Love the fire pits and the overall atmosphere. I will definetley be back,

OMG FANTASTIC!! The French toast was soooooo gooood...I special ordered it with just bananas and strawberries, the idea of grapes and melon on French Toast didn't sit right with me. We ate there two days in a row. Both days we sat at the counter because the wait was 20-30+ minutes. They have giant coffee cups which was great - no waiting for refills. Atmosphere is great - old school neon and such. You can even have a cocktail with breakfast. Go it is work the wait.

Five stars for all the years of great memories...this is the place to go if you want a taste of Vegas as it once was...the restaurant has been my go to spot since I was a toddler, good solid food, big portions, friendly and fast service, fun Vegas style sparkly interior...the lounge with their indoor fire pit, great cocktails, old school videos,friendly cocktail dress wearing servers, and if your lucky fellow customers that walked right out of a mob movie with their lovely ladies, all make for one great experience that is not to be missed ; }

Cool atmosphere. The food was pretty good. My Mushroom & Swiss burger was a little greasy. For the price, it could've had more mushrooms. And the mushrooms tasted canned but they were still good. Hubby loved his burger. He got the Pastrami Burger. The onion rings were amazing and the fries were good too. 

The waiter seemed new. Was super friendly, maybe a little tooooo friendly lol but he was okay...

Food wasn't super hot/fresh when we got it, but nothing to really complain about, we were hungry! 
We would go again. 

You'll spend at least $11-$13/meal

I saw peppermill cafe online and it was highly recommended. We made a reservation for a Tuesday morning with a group of 12 and were more than impressed. If you want a classic throwback to old vegas, have a meal here. The fireside lounge is pretty unique and the restaurant is tastefully ornate. Meals were huge and drinks were delicious. Our server was on point and had a great personality. I will absolutely return next time I'm in town. Make a reservation or plan to wait at least 30 min because it gets very crowded!

Went here on a saturday morning with my husband and two old friends who had flown into Vegas 15 minutes prior, demanding brunch. After any buffet, Egg Works, and Hash House were all shot down for having too large of portion sizes, I finally sold them on the Peppermill, largely by promising them neon.

Pros: 
 - Damn tasty diner food and freely flowing cups of coffee. This is all I really ask for in a solid Brunch Experience
-Super friendly staff and prompt service, and no problems with slightly different orders and keeping coffee coming.
- The look on my friends' faces when they realized this place didn't have small portions either! Oh noes, mah dietz. I laughed and laughed and laughed/

Cons:
- Long wait, really with no where to sit and wait. We hung out on a curb and were frequently asked if we needed a cab.
- Prices were a bit on the high side relative to the awesomeness of the food. Got the impression I was paying for the neon. Wasn't too bad, but also nothing to compose a sonnet over.

Overall Verdict:
- Yummy classic diner food in a classically vegas atmosphere. Will return when hungover, or with out of town and unadventurous guests. Won't be on the favorites anytime list, but certainly not shabby.

Kitschy Vegas all the way!  This places screams good times and scandalous fireside hook-ups in the lounge.  No, no, not for me, but I can see it happenin' for you single, lusty Vegas guys and gals.  

I just returned from my very first Vega-licious adventure and it wouldn't have been the same without a stop at The Peppermill.  I, along with my two fabulous female friends, had a blast here.  Shared a scorpion bowl, snapped some hilarious photos and relaxed by the firepit/fountain/pool thingy.  Cozy seating, fabulous waitresses in Halstonesque long black gowns, and tons of Vegas cheese!  Loved it.  I'll be back.

Your standard diner. Huge portions, typical menu, comfy seating to reflect on your crazy Vegas adventures. The food isn't Michelin star quality, but you're probably looking for some drunchies anyway! It will be perfect. A little ways down the strip but worth the work getting there.

Had the Peppermill pastrami burger and it was excellent! Fast and friendly service, reasonably priced for Vegas. Actually anywhere! I would come back for more... I say get away from the hotels and explore. The Peppermill is an example of a great find when you take a chance!

This review is for the  dining room only, not the bar/ lounge:


Most places in las vegas close at or about 10:00pm on any given day however the peppermill is constantly open.

Nice and polite staff -

Great food -

and depending on the dishes you order; Giant portions.


I have a few dishes and I consider the caprice sandwich [I think its name is the caprice] is the worst dish I had; while the reuben sandwich is practically the best you could ever have.

While its not like the top restaurants at the Aria and the Wynn; you will not be disappointed at the food they have there. If for nothing else, the outfits the waitresses wear do make the experience that more enjoyable.

If you ever have a chance to to anywhere to eat in las vegas, I would greatly recommend the peppermill.

I am a fan of The Peppermill. A big fan. I love the 50's diner look from the outside, the massive portions of virtually anything you can chow down either at a table or at the counter in the restaurant. Nachos are great, huge and perfect for that: "it's 4am and I need food, stat" moment; best shared with a friend or 12. Breakfast foods are equally large portions: pancake lovers rave over their stacks; many of my burger loving friends have raved about the burgers. I usually have a gynormous salad, while iceberg isn't my favorite, it is more than adequate here (I never leave without a to-go box) Love that they are open 24/7 and the kitschy decor in the diner. There can be relatively long waits during breakfast hours and at seemingly random times. Worth the wait. Also, it is easy walking distance from many spots on the Strip, so you can walk off some of those drinks/nachos. Recently walked from TI & Bellagio. 

Just the diner side would make this great to this NYer who misses a diner. But then...you walk into the Fireside Lounge and are transported into the 1970's (overheard a man telling his wife "it looks like a den of iniquity")  Velvet couches in the round with flat screens playing old school videos, plus the famous floating fireplace add to the unique ambience; there are even matchbooks at your tables. There are gaming spots at bar, if that's your thing. 

Drinks follow the throwback theme along with Mai Tais, Scorpions & other "Girl Drink Drunk" offerings (check out classic Kids in the Hall skit on You Tube, riff on Days of Wine and Roses but very Vegas) and unique dessert themed libations. There's frequently a roving photographer to present a memento of what always turns out to be a good time for local and tourists alike. 

The waitresses wear long black cocktail dresses, and do the classic "Bunny dip" to place coasters and serve -- reminiscent of the old Playboy Clubs -- there's a decent array of  bar food and appetizers. On my last trip in April we had Caprese Salad (very good) Shrimp Cocktail (a ok) Chicken Quesadillas (really good, very flaky but took forever to come out) and something else I didn't eat but my friend enjoyed it. Drinks are potent, service can be a tad slow, but friendly. Our water glasses were always filled, drinks refreshed and waitress did keep in touch regarding wayward item. 

The people watching alone is worth a visit. Depending on what time you are there, you'll start to see hungry clubbers, hungry/thirsty "dancers " and just your variety of only-in-Vegas sightings. From about 3AM on it gets really shall we say, eclectic?' 

So, I'm a fan. Always have been, always will be. It is a cool spot to chow down, get your drink on or snuggle up to your honey. Long live The Peppermill!

Your typical diner fare. We had a large family dinner at this location and it was OK. The manager was a bit abrasive when the reservation we made wasn't ready on time and I asked her about it.
