I like that in this case because...it's Las Vegas! All tourists from what I can tell and there's nothing wrong with that. I'm a tourist after all. I always get an omelette no matter what time of day it is. The waitresses are competent and that's fine. The price is not that high at all. Parking is easy but can be crowded. I like the place. They seemed to have eliminated the Maserati Omelette from the menu though. Bummer. Maybe I just missed seeing it. Had a Denver and it was great.

There were three of us together wanting to get some grub and right when we walk in we already knew their was going to be a wait; it was pretty packed - the receptionist said that it was going to be a 25-30 minute wait, which ended up to be 1.5 hours! I also noticed that she told that to every single customer that and they ended up waiting just as long as we did if not longer. The decor is different, unique. The waitresses were on point and it seemed like they all worked together. The food was pretty good - worth the wait, it was an awesome amount of food too! Besides the receptionist lying about the wait it ober all was a good experience. Also, a lady walks around and asks to take your pictures which was actually pretty nice rather than annoying because well you are trying to eat,  we ended up buying the pics too!

After a very long night, Elizabeth D. and i wake up and crawl into a cab. its about 3:30pm and we ask the cabbie where we can get a good breakfast. he says "the Peppermill is pretty good"

PRETTY GOOD?! This place is amazing. We didnt know what hit us, it was like our dreamland come true, except for all the smoke. yuck.

anyhoo, we shared the Fantasia waffle with sour cream (definitely the way to go) and the best biscuits and gravy that we had ever encountered in our entire lives.

The bloody mary would have been delicious if the celery stick wasnt monstrous and made every sip taste like i was actually taking a bite.

sooooo, after our meal we decided to check out the fireside lounge.  The fire pits in a hot tub? could this get any better?

the next day we dragged our tired asses and our friends back to our found treasure for our last meal in town. too bad i was hung over and threw up everything i ate on the way home : (  soooo worth it

Going here once a year, and it never disappoints! It is north of the strip,  easy walk from Encore Hotel if staying there. The place is fantasticly retro with a pink flamingo theme and servers in nice dresses.  

The food is good and the portions huge.  One dish is enough, no starters haha. 

Going here is like going back in time, and while waiting for food, check out the fancy  bar with a fire pit. 

I have only gone here for breakfast and if lucky, you get a table right a way but expect the place to be busy. 

So,  lean back and Picture Elvis sitting here in the early 70s with a nice portion of omelette :)

this is for the fireside lounge.
great place to finish the night off or start it.  the appetizers were large portions and the well drinks were also great.  it has a old las Vegas feel to it
Great fire Jacuzzi nice atmosphere normally good service

Late to the game again.  I've lived in Vegas since 1992 and just recently made my first visit to this spot that's a favorite with visitors and locals.  It looks like some kinda Miami Vice-inspired disco with all the purple and pink neon inside, but it also has waitresses who wear blue and white old-school uniforms and call you "honey."  The menu has something for everyone, which is a good thing since it's open 24/7 and you never know what you'll be craving in the wee hours.  
The first visit, I had an omelet which, upon ordering, I had no idea would be made with 10 whole eggs!  No wonder I couldn't even finish half.  The second visit the other day, I ordered the turkey club with fries and that was also a healthy portion, but I was able to finish most of it in one sitting.  There was some kind of mishap in the kitchen, though, with my dish taking the longest to arrive.  Our waitress was very good about getting the sandwich comped because of the delay and the head chef also came by our table to apologize.   
Depending on the time of day you come, there will be a wait, so be prepared since this is a popular place.  We ate lunch here two days ago on Friday, November 11th, at 12:30pm, and waited about 30 minutes.  Mind you, it was a holiday, so considering that, the line wasn't horrible. 
If you have room left, get an ice cream sundae.  We got the hot fudge and demolished it.

This review was meant to go out when I last ate here with my best friend so ignore the date. We love this place, what we do is get all dressed up 1940's style and we have been doing it like this since 2001 when everything in our hometown Vegas has been done. We order nachos oh they are soooooo good site by the fire and drink huge strawberry daq's just next time keep me away from the sprinkles and straws. I made a mess once but was not my fault it was 2am and th estraw wanted to land on the ground. 

Great place to go. Its old school Vegas and it stayed that way.
Old school, big portions, ask for fresh jalepenos and if you want to see locals other than the staff, go in the middle of the night.

IMHO the best place on the strip for a cool dark drink. Or an early breakfast to recuperate from last night. We've been coming here when in Vegas for 20 years, and the funky color scheme and friendly service remain authentic. Breakfasts are huge and about $13, but they don't mind two people sharing. Did I mention they have the best Bloody Mary west of New Orleans? The servers are fast and really friendly. Special shout out to our server Alicia!

One of my favorite places!  I come here at least once every time I'm in Vegas, I have been here about 5 times already this year!  I usually go to the lounge in the early morning hours where I enjoy an oatmeal cookie martini, and sometimes comfort food.  On my most recent trip I sat in the restaurant part and was very impressed with the food and portion sizes!  Next time I am going to try the breakfast, it looked amazing!

Came here for breakfast on a Saturday. Service was subpar. Had a drink in the bar (which was tasty), but the bartender (David?) was short and unfriendly. After we were seated, we saw our waitress twice. Food was ok...I would compare to Denny's. I did love the motif though.

I have been here a few times and always for breakfast.  Needless to say on those days, I did not need to eat lunch!  HUGE portions at a reasonable price.  Great place to come after a bender.  Will go back next time I am in Vegas!
A great place for all appetites.  With a full bar for the adult eaters.

Decided  to give this place a try. Upon walk in and putting my name down, I notice  the décor. The waiting   area has 3 tv screen showing fish. The place  has lots of neon and plush seats, very beautiful. The place  was very crowed  with a 45 minute wait. Took  a quick  peek into their  fireside lounge. wow was it amazing looking with very beautiful fire pits. Pictures on here do not do it justice. Finally get seated. Did  not  care for them serving Pepsi over coke (thanks to the drink  server for making it a point to me). We were a party of 3. I went for the Philly cheese steak and onion rings. When it arrived i was in aww at it's size. It look amazing and it was. Generous portions of steak covered I'm melted cheese and pepers. Wife got the foccacia chicken  sandwich also with onion rings. It also looked amazing. She really enjoyed it. My brother got the country fried  steak with mashed pots and veggies, also came with a hearty chicken noodle  soup. He also enjoyed it. Service was good. Now for price, ie say a bit in the high side  but not  for what you get. Price are similar to claim jumpers. All in all this will be our  new go to spot, when in town. Yum yum

A Vegas must for breakfast. The atmosphere alone is worth the stop. It's like stepping into an iconic Vegas movie set.  

The service was friendly and prompt,  the omelet enormous and even the coffee mugs were oversized. We're contemplating breakfast there again but maybe splitting something would be a wise choice this time

.

Who cannot love this place!  Great food and even better atmosphere!  One half is a 70's jungle lounge where they serve food and the other half is a great bar with a fire pit inside!  The bloodies are AMAZING!  I try to stop here every time I am visiting Vegas!

So we arrived on friday night and we were wanting to eat and we weren't wanting a all you can eat place. So I looked on yelp and read your reviews and I figured yes we will eat here. Turned out it was close by and we walked over from the Hilton Resort. Turned out this place is like a Denny's but with tripple the price tag and the portions larger. We all ordered breakfast and I would say we all enjoyed our breakfast. The place had a few roudy people but it was a good place to hang-out. The only thing that I would recommend is to be able to move the table out a little because I felt I was in a tight booth.  

As we left the place I wanted to check out the pool of fire but that was in another section and it was cozy in there but there was way too much smoke in there.  maybe next time were in the hood we'll check out the lounge area and hang.

The food was good but the service was not very good. First off I had to ask for my server to come to our table. I got a kids meal for my baby which was the pasta. I asked for the meat sauce and the spaghetti sauce was spicy, I'm sure most kids don't want spicy food. The manager came and said yeah the sauce is kinda spicy so it was barely even eaten and I looked confuse because what restaurant feed kids spicy food. I told them to take the food cause my baby didn't want to eat it but I will still pay for it but they insisted that I don't have to pay for it. Then they came back rushing us out asking if we want a to go box, when we were still eating and drinking, how rude is that !! Our server was talking to her boyfriend a table just right in front of us and I have to try to get her attention every time we needed something. But the manager at that time was kind of pushing us to leave which was rude.
Love coming here for brunch. The staff is friendly and attentive. Food portions are huuuge with more than enough to share. Will be back again.

Who doesn't go to The Peppermill when they are in Las Vegas?? I've had many happy times here. Falling asleep on the table while waiting for my breakfast.. lol 
My friend from Vegas always set out this place as a meeting place. :-) 
Good chance for me to grab the TEN EGGS OMELET! Heeeeheee, I always get high on protein after it. But of course I share with my buddies. 
Huge portion, nice employees, 24 hrs!!

What the say is true! PORTIONS ARE HUGE!! I mean like GINORMOUS!! But well worth it! 

Decor was very retro. It almost looked like it was a converted strip club at one point, but it works well as it has a diner-ish feel to it.

We got a Lorraine Omelet and Corn Beef Hash. The omelet was bigger than the size of my face. I swear!! It was good cause it was nice and fluffy with the freshest ingredients. The hash browns OMG the hash browns were so crispy and good. I noticed they also add sweet onions to it cause some bites would be sweet. I finished the hash browns first before I finished my Omelette.. The Corn Beef Hash was sooo good as well. It was like happiness in my mouth! 

I tried the Bloody Mary and it was pretty good. I could taste the celery salt with the big celery they put inside it. But it was pretty tasty. =D

Definitely a place to go back to without a doubt! =D

Huge portions...nothing super fantastic about the food but we had to come to the iconic Peppermill...I've been coming to Vegas since I was a baby and had never had the opportunity to come by here until last August...i'm glad I did...I came, I ate and I saw...I might be back again but there are soooo many amazing options in Vegas that this will fall pretty low on my "restaurants to repeat" list

it is always nice to visit the peppermill, especially after a night of heavy drinking :)  the reason I did not give it 5 stars is because our waitress was kinda of a bi**h.  she had attitude, she would slide stuff across the table, she didnt bring us any condiments.  The bus boy had to get our sodas and our syrup.  the sampler platter was good it came with chicken strips, mozarella sticks, bruchetta, fried shrimp, and onion rings. All the food was pretty good, its just the service they have to work on

What an awesome experience! We put our name on the list and the wait was about 50 minutes so we decided to go to one of the nearby hotels and hangout. Sure enough when we came back we were next to be called awesome timing. We got seated and started looking over the menu. I ordered the eggs Benedict. Huge portion and it tasted wonderful. How did I never try this place? The decor looks like an old hotel with all the neon lights but the customer service was super friendly and fast even with it being so busy. The prices are average I wouldn't say it's expensive especially with the size portions that you get. I will deff be back thanks again peppermill!

Ok so maybe my expectations were too high, everyone kept recommending this place saying how awesome the food was. It was Sunday, a few hours before we had to fly home. We usually like to hit someplace unique to vegas, something like hash house a go go or oyster bar before flying home. The cab driver mentioned Peppermill and since we have always heard great things decided to try it. Nothing was bad, but everything was just ordinary, except maybe the size of the plates. Peppermill burger was just ho hum, chicken fried steak and eggs - no different from anything else. The interior was cool, waitress was awesome. To me tho it's just an ordinary diner, can't imagine going back for anything really

Old school charm, that's why you go here. The food is meh, it's a diner after all, and best at 3 am after a lot of drinks elsewhere. Speaking of drinks, they have quite a few to choose from, lots of cocktails but unfortunately a rather poor beer selection, only Stella on tap, but they poor it well, so hard to complain. It's got two sides, diner with the full menu, then the "lounge" with the water/fire pit. I think your best bet is to go at the end of your night, when you're a little munchy, get a few appetizers and a nightcap then cab it home as the sun comes up.

screw the dennys on the strip....this is the perfect place to go after a late night. The Peppermill is a fairly large restaurant with an old school diner feel. it's on the strip, the waitresses are sassy, and the portions are large. That and you can walk in here with a huge group of people and get seated immediately. the decor made me feel like i was in jurassic park...but i'm not sure why. something about all the greenery and the neon.

granted, i don't really remember what the food tasted like...but they have rainbow sprinkles available on every table! wheee!

The interior is Gaudy and reminds me being in some strip bar but it is so Las Vegas! The food was good, but not the best. The portions were huge and the service great! The prices were a little but by the looks of the place being full......I guess people are willing to pay.

I have not been to the Peppermill since before yelp was on the internet and every time I did go it was after a long night partying or out drinking where to be honest anything tastes good.
Not so now, I had buddies of mine coming into town Friday morning and of course they could not check in to the hotel because it was too early and they were both starving for some food.
I wanted to stay on the strip and suddenly the Peppermill came into my mind, I know they are open 24/7 and they serve breakfast.
So upon arrival (it was around 10am) we rolled up to the Pepermill and were greeted with a 30 min wait time and the reception area was packed with people waiting.  
Then I remembered the lounge out back that serves some of the best Bloody Mary's I can remember having, so off we went to spend our wait time in the lounge.  man I'm glad I did, it was exactly like I remembered it pink and purple neon everywhere and the small water fire pit in the middle....Classic.
Our waitress came and took out orders quickly and then returned with them just as fast, the Bloody Mary was exactly like I remembered them and you get at plethora of choices for your vodka, anyway we had two drinks each while we waited and was then called to our table.
Our waitress gave us ample time to look and order from the menu which I was surprised at seeing as the place was packed, I was  expecting her to rush us and get us out of there.
the portions are HUGE! and can easily be shared, I ordered the corned beef hash with eggs, there must have been a pound of corned beef with a crispy crust and three, yes three fried eggs on top.   
Mmmmm The corned beef was crispy on the outside but once you cut into it, it was moist and creamy then once you cut open one of the eggs and the yolk mixes into the corned beef I was in heaven.
I wish it was closer to my house so I could go more often but for anyone on the strip and bear in mind the Peppermill is located quite far down the north of the strip across from Circus Circus and the old Riviera it is still a must go to for a great meal ANYTIME of the day or night.

I've eaten at the Peppermill a number of times over the last 5 or 6 years. I usually arrive into Vegas on a later, after-work flight from the East coast. By the time I get checked in to my hotel and all cleaned up for the evening, many of the hotel dining options are closed or things are winding down. Thankfully, the Peppermill is open 24 hours with a full menu. It is a fantastic diner with a great menu, and soo much character. It's clean, the wait staff is friendly and top notch. Also, the late-night manager is friendly, always on her toes, and interested in hearing about the customer experience. She does a great job both supporting and orchestrating the service staff. 

I have ordered many entrees, both dinner and breakfast selections, some of which include the following:  Berry Spinach Salad, Crab Cakes, Omelettes, Chicken and Red Pepper Pasta, Swiss and Mushroom Burger, Creamy Chicken Dijon, Pesto Chicken Sandwich, Tomato Bisque, Chicken Noodle Soup. My favorite is the Creamy Chicken Dijon dinner. Two generous pieces of pounded chicken served on top of mashed potatoes with a vegetable, often green beans, and of course the creamy dijon sauce.  It is a large portion entree, as most of the dishes served are. I'm surprised there are not pictures of this entree in the photos section. The specialty drinks are excellent too. Cocktail waitresses in black gowns take your drink order which is prepared by the bartenders in the Fireside Lounge. I've ordered the Blue Hawaii a couple of times, and I have a friend that loves the Espresso Martini.

After dinner, I usually get a couple of drinks in the Fireside Lounge. You get certain drinks comp'd if you play the video casino games at the bar. However, I have to warn you, the games seem tighter than many of the machines I've played at different locations in Vegas. You may want to consider abstaining from play and just pay outright for your drinks. All in all, the lounge is a comfortable place to get a few drinks with friends after dinner.

I gave this restaurant a very high rating, taking into consideration it is an upscale diner, with its own unique signature ambiance.

This is a regular stop at least a couple times every visit. The menu is huge almost tonight but it provides something for everyone and it's still quality food. Along with the quality you get a old Vegas feel inside the restaurant with it's very neat decore.

I have ALWAYS had a great experience here and being that it's open 24 hours a day AND it's Kid friendly, makes it really convenient for us. The decor is fun and electric (literally ELECTRIC)! It's great late night comfort food, especially when you've been drinking and partying all night...er.. when you DON'T have the kids, of course!
Okay so my review is for May 2010 when we visited here. It was our first night in Las Vegas and a first time bringing a child and...me being 7 months pregnant (so no partying for me this time! I was craving steak and was VERY skeptical about ordering it at a place like this. I ordered the New York ! New York ! 27.95 (yes, the price is quite high) ***PEPPERMILL DESCRIPTION: 12oz. hand-cut and trimmed, flame-broiled to perfection and served with sautéed mushrooms.*** Let me tell you that for someone that actually does NOT consider herself a red meat lover and eats it only on rare occassions (even though all my reviews seem to be centered on steak houses and burger joints LOL!), THIS WAS EXCELLANT EXCELLANT EXCELLANT! The kitchen staff really know their steaks! I thought there was a bone in it and kept eating around it...it was all cut with no bone! And being pregnant I had to order it more cooked than I would usually so I believe I got it Medium-Well...still amazing! Flavorful AND tender! So 5 stars there!
On another night (with our little one), we went just for dessert and ordered the Strawberry Shortcake 6.95
***PEPPERMILL DESCRIPTION: Moist slices of pound cake, a generous helping of strawberries and creamy French vanilla ice cream, all topped with real whipping cream.*** WHAT A TREAT! Fantastic! LOVED IT! We were all so tired and our little boy started getting cranky and fighting over bites and finally it ended up toppeling all over the table! Haha, it was a fun night. We love the Peppermill! ***Don't forget to wave to the kitchen staff on your way out. They REALLY appreciate that. :)
FIRESIDE LOUNGE: When my man and I go to Las Vegas as adults, we LOVE the Fireside Lounge in all it's glowing ambiance! The drinks are fun, the hostesses are beautiful and elegant and they are always nice about taking our picture by the molten fire pit, hehe. The only thing I am sad about are the TV's they put in. They are  really distracting. If anyone knows the owners there, PLEASE tell them to take them out!

Disco brunch!

I love how in Vegas everything is neon and looks like a slot machine.  I have never been to one but I bet even the laundromats in vegas make you stoked to put your quarters in the slot, cuz you just might win!  Win getting your clothes clean that is!

Anyways, back to the peppermill.  This place was so awesome.  Neon, glamorous, chromey interior. Just the thing you need after you've been at a gentlemen's club till 7am that same morning.   So you hit the Peppermill.  It's nice and cool, and darkly lit, and the waitresses are really chill.  They serve HUGE bloody marys and mimosas.  (The bloodies need more horseradish though.)   

Food portions are huge and the menu is extensive.  You will definitely find something to eat here.  

there is even a lounge in the back with a cool fire pit you can sit by if you want even more of the hair of the dog.   

This is a great place to go to re-calorize for your flight home.   A fitting end to a great vegas weekend!
Breakfast before going to convention Center . Good hearty breakfast. I had hash scramble with a spicy kieblasa type sausage in it with onions and peppers. More food than I can eat which says a ton.

Gross so ughhhh yucky:( once we walked in they ask us do u want something from the bar we said no thanks we live here... Servers was nice food was grossssssss!! I just ate my toast and my bf was looking at me because I'm the one who wanted to come here lol servers was nice decor cool I guess but never again..I feel like the people that think this place is good is because they're drunk and they have no tastebuds lol but we was sober and boy it was horrible
The best hot wings ever! Burger was also great. They even made my 10 year old son his own pizza which isn't even on their menu. Definitely coming back next time I'm in Las Vegas.

If you're ever in Las Vegas, Peppermill is the place to have breakfast! The food is super good. The servings are huge so sharing is always good. The atmosphere is great & so is the customer service. A++++

Visiting Vegas again on business, left me staying at the Hilton on the North end of the strip across from Circus X2. What I didn't foresee was a Hilton, on the strip, with NO bar and NO restaurant. No problem, the Peppermill is just down the street. 

My coworker and I drive there to find a mostly empty parking lot, which made us think the place may be low on the popularity scale. However, in Vegas a lot if people walk the strip and inside, the place was full. 

I ordered the chicken and red pepper pasta. This dish was recommended by two employees.   I found this dish to be very run-of-the-mill.  

The cream cheese stuffed chicken was not outstanding. The cream cheese adversely affected the consistency and "bite" of the chicken while I found the red pepper cream sauce to be rather one-dimensional. 

The bruschetta appetizer and mixed drinks were very good. 

The service was very good and kind of made up for the rather average food offering.

Pros: good service, unusual decor and setting, made up for entrée.

Cons: entree a little sub-par

Bad experience. I was excited to eat at a Peppermill as I used to love the one in Concord, CA. Either things changed or this is not a good restaurant.

I walked in and was seated at the counter (per my request). Although the spot was not cleaned, I assumed it would be soon. The waitress came, after a longer than average wait upon arriving, took my drink order, and left to give me time to decide what I wanted. Five or so minutes later, she returned to take my order. I saw her again once my food was ready and she looked at the spot in front of me with a look like "where should I put this (as no one came to clean the counter). So I said "well I guess I'll sit over here since no one is going to clean this" and sat in the empty space to my right. She looked at me with the 'deer in the headlights' look and said "oh, uh, sorry". She set my food down and I didn't see her again until she breezed by to drop off my check. She had time to chit-chat to another patron (an obvious regular) but not to see if I needed anything (like a drink refill). Just as I am ready to leave to pay, she then notices my empty glass and asks if I need a refill.
The food was mediocre but no where near what it used to be, and the fries were barely luke warm.
I paid, left her a low tip but still more than I should have, and left. The spot I originally sat at had never been cleared. My first and last visit here. I can get better service and food from Denny's........and I hate Denny's!
Many hotel cafe's either close early or food is poor quaity. Peppermill prices are on par with most cafes in the area and they give you a load of food! For late night dining this place fits the bill.

From the pictures, I expected this up scale modern restaurant. 

Nope. It's a diner (at least in the afternoon). 

Googlemaps failed me and my friends and I wandered a bit after we got off the express Deuce. If you're taking the same form of transportation, be on the lookout. It's located as it's own separate building as a restaurant and is not located in a casino. 

The food was good. Definitely recommend the salads! PORTIONS ARE HUGEEE! Had more avocado than we knew what to do with and I LOVE AVOCADO! Large bushel of grapes were also a highlight. Four stars for the salads, minus a star for the lack luster service.

They're also hawking photos here, which kind of sleazed up our experience, but hey, we got a free photo to go with the memories!
The age of the neon lights with a fireplace center sitting!  Awesome drinks in a fabulous atmosphere!
The wait was long, but the food was well worth it!  I shared the crab cake Benedict with my friend and so glad I did because the portion was HUGE.  Will definitely go back next time I'm in Vegas.

I'm going to be very forgiving of some service issues because the food was just that good.  Our waitress seemed overwhelmed and got 3 aspects of our order messed up, but in the end it all got to our table and was phenomenal.  The omelets are the size of a half-football, which we noticed while being seated, so two of us split one (good choice) and still had some left over after stuffing ourselves.  We will absolutely go back next time we're in Vegas

I was introduced to the Peppermill by a good friend who is a Vegas local. He brought me here for the first time in May 2016. Now on my 6th Vegas trip of 2016, I've made it a point to come in and have breakfast at least one of the mornings I am here. I've come to Vegas with different people on most of my trips this year and have always brought them here and they enjoy it too. Love the casual, fun ambiance and culture of the restaurant. Can definitely say my favorite meal is the French Toast Collage and a nice big Mimosa from the bar.

Oh Peppermill. Why do I love you so?
This place has a really special place in my heart......perhaps it's due in part to the nostalgia I feel because of the many memories I've made in the COUNTLESS trips there after club night outs, birthday parties or just because In the last decade. 
Every time I go, I'm never disappointed with the price, food or location. 
Their drink menu is extensive and fun. The food .... Every order will undoubtedly require a box. The location naturally entails a plethora of interesting people (celebrities and hookers a like) . When in Vegas..... Peppermill it.

Biggest omelette I've ever seen.  Seriously, what's the deal with this five-egg monstrosity?  Even sharing it took two people two days to take that thing down.  I appreciate a large meal, but jeez.  The hash browns were great, not amazing.

The decor is garish and horrible but very Vegas and endlessly fascinating, so I guess it gets a pass.  The place was packed, and it was a bit slow, but who knows if that's the norm.  Pretty traditional diner food.

This is my third time here. I come here every time I come to Vegas and want a filling meal! I have gotten the Masarati omelet before and it was well worth it, it has close to a dozen eggs. This time I got the French  toast Ambrosia. It was really good and of course could have fed a few people. Really good food
Worth the wait to eat massive portions of consistently delicious food. My favorite omelet is the Maserati.
Unexpectedly amazing food. Scramble was awesome and one of the best blueberry muffins I've had!! Served hot for a nice touch. And lastly, spectacular service!

Not really knowing about this place, we decided to try it out. Wow. We were NOT disappointed one bit. The scorpion bite drink was HUGE and pretty pricey, but worth it for sure. 

I cant wait to go back this summer, and try their food..

Everything you read in reviews for this restaurant is true. When you enter the restaurant you are seemingly transported back in time to an earlier Vegas. The service is outstanding, with separate waitresses for your food and cocktails. They mix a mean bloody mary! You better bring a huge appetite because the portions here are incredibly large and tasty.

Me and my friend came here for some late night eating and I got to say, worst sandwich I've ever had in my life. we got the mozzarella with tomato sandwich. It was just what you read. Cold ass tomato and cold ass mozzarella. Not grilled or even warmed up or anything. I forced myself to eat half before I was sure I was going to vomit.
The only great thing about this place is the colorful sugar I kept snacking on through the whole visit, and their gigantic ice cream sundae. Now that is what dreams are made of.

After a very very I mean very long night at prive, we were starving! We decided to head to the peppermill. Our taxi driver that took us there was crazy... i mean i think he smoked some crack before he was driving, but he was cool though.. he knew everything about the peppermill, and told me to get the fruit bowls.He said, "It's the best fruit bowl you'll ever have in Las Vegas" hahaha lol! Let me tell you... the fruit bowl was nasty. Don't order it.  Food was great, i love the stripper theme, that's always hot for a bunch of drunk people. The worst part about this place is that no taxi's will pick you up from here so beware... come here with caution if you're drunk! You'll have a long walk back to you're hotel, unless you're staying at sleezy hotel like the riviera, or circus circus.

Best breakfast in Vegas! Be prepared to share as the portions are humongous. The hubs and I barely made a dent in the 1 side pancake we ordered. It was moist and delicious. The Lorraine omelet had the perfect portions of bacon, onions and cheese. Coffee cups are deep keeping the coffee warm throughout your meal. Definitely choose the side muffin over toast or bagel. They are moist and yummy, perfect warmed up the next morning with your hotel coffee. Didn't get a chance to sit in the fireside lounge as our visit was a short one but we will be making the Peppermill a Vegas tradition from now on.

The Peppermill restaurant has been around for such a long time and they know how Vegas locals and tourists like it. 

Portions here are so big, I think you pretty much have to split it with someone or be prepared to take it home. Prices are reasonable comparing it to the portions you get. 

The only downfall to this place which I feel doesn't take away from the rating is the long wait to get a table. Some suggestions are to call ahead, they are usually willing to put you on the list or hang out at the lounge and start out with cocktails. That's never a bad idea. 

We came here for breakfast and the omelettes were huge. Probably made with 8-10 eggs and full with ingredients in every bite. 

We will definitely comeback and bring lots of hungry friends.

I was lucky that my new local friends pointed me to this spot.

This is old Las Vegas.. tacky to the max with the neon colors in the napkins, décor, etc.  I loved it.  There is a cocktail waitress who served good Bloody Mary's (heard the mimosas weren't that good).. and the food was large in portion but in my opinion.. not as good as Hash A Go Go.  Hash Browns were incredibly crispy and delicious.

The most amazing part is the fireside lounge where it's a round lounge around a fire that's on water.  It's truly amazing and reminds me of what a backroom of a strip club would look like if I were to go to those in Vegas (I haven't although I tried to once.. I swear!)

Great spot to visit... 3.5 stars.  Free parking and gladly it is not on the Strip with all the terrible parking and traffic.

Remember those nights when you were absolutely gone and coming back from a club and needing some type of sustenance? Remember when you would hit up Denny's and wreak havoc on their menus, staff and bathrooms? Well, when you're in Vegas, fuck Denny's. Peppermill is here.

I don't know what kind of theme this place is going for. Everything about it screams cum stained strip club from the velvet seats to the neon ceiling lighting. I mean everytime I come here I seriously am anticipating fog to come out of one of the planters and up comes up Trixie the Tranny to start dancing. It's just reaaallly weird to be in this place but it's so exciting! Like I said, the place itself looks like a strip club, but the menus and the theme are completely different. I guess it's just bad marketing ideas for whatever they're trying to pull off.

Aside from the decor, the food is fantastic. Big plates of just pure American feast. And if you didn't know already, when you order their omelettes or anything with eggs, they use 10 eggs. Yeah. TEN. The hash browns are perfection. I highly doubt you'll ever finish your food, but if you do, you should enter yourself in an Eating Competition. And when you do finish your food, make sure there's a bathroom nearby that you can destroy. On top of all this, the staff is really nice! Kick ass staff and kick ass food in a kick ass strip club! Kick ass!

Went here late night/early morning and it was a disaster. Was with a group of 6 with one woman who was Jewish and wearing the required snood for her religion. We were all settled in and enjoying the fireside when the waitress informed our friend she couldn't sit on that side of the restaurant because of her head covering. So they told her she would have to sit on the ice side, which none of us wanted to do. We were outraged! We understood we were sitting 3 ft away from a fire pit that was in the center of a pool. We are all over the age of 26, did they think we were gonna play with fire? Even though we had already placed our orders we left and will never return.
Large portions, breakfast and the rest, 24hrs. Nice service moderately expensive. A New Jersey Diner transplanted on LV Blvd, but this one's in better condition.

I liked the ambiance of this diner and I appreciated the variety in the menu selections, but I thought it was a little overpriced. I got the veggie burger and requested no mayo, but had to send it back because there was mayo on it. When the bun came back, it was covered in butter. What do I have to do to get a plain bun around here? Unfortunately I was too sleep deprived and too cranky to enjoy the food by then. It didn't help that my bf and I started arguing. And the table across from us offered unsolicited advice on how to get ketchup out of the bottle. I wish I was in a better mood, I don't think I gave this place a fair shot.

You definitely get the Las Vegas vibe when you walk into this place.  The blue neon lights every where is a tribute to the Las Vegas of yester-year.  We came here for breakfast and ordered a chicken fired steak, a classic Eggs Benedict and kids pancake for my four year old.  The chicken fried steak and the Eggs Benedict were good.  Quality you would expect from a good old fashioned diner.  The portions are pretty big even for american standards so come hungry.  Service was a little slow but all in all a great alternative to the overpriced resorts.

So their food isn't all that bad. However I ordered an omelet with no cow cheese (my allergies were acting up) and realized after a few bites they had put both goat and cow cheese on. There was some crazy stringy cheese action going on. I sent it back and the manager Martha brought it out 10 minutes later to point out how there was no stringy cheese. And of course tell me I was wrong because that's the best way to keep customers in their place. Obviously the stringy cheese quality goes away when it's cold!! Way to go Martha! A plus service!

My friends and I ended up here because it was close to the Wynn. However, when we asked a hotel employee for directions we were informed we made a "extremely good choice". And she was right. We arrived at 2am with the place packed. The food was quick and absolutely delicious. I wish I could eat there every day. The menu also had a HUGE variety of things so everyone was satisfied. It also had a cocktail waitress then deliver to your table.

Peppermill is definitely eye catching alone with the rainbow colored signs, but the neon does not end with the signs. When you walk in, you are immediately greeted by more neon and mirrors! If neon and mirrors is your thing, then you'll feel right at home!

I have to admit that the combination of neon and the crowds of people on the strip really does draw attention to itself. The lounge atmosphere in the Fireside Lounge is amazing. It is a very relaxing place and not too loud so that you can carry on a conversation. Whether you're going for cocktails in the lounge or looking for a decent coffee shop in Vegas - you won't be disappointed. The giant omelettes are what the Peppermill are most famous for. As far as the service goes - absolutely lovely! 

Any visit to Las Vegas should include a visit to Peppermill!
The best hot wings and curly fries on this side of the Mississippi!!!! It was amazing grace!!!! I'm from TN and was visiting and I will be back next month!!!!!!

We arrived here about 3am and it's exactly where I needed to be. I got a front row seat next to the fireplace and while my stomach was growling and my head spinning from the cocktails earlier in the night... I was completely mesmerized by the fire and all the blue pink neon. It's sooooo 80s. I love it!

The food was okay. Nothing special. But... the atmosphere is awesome especially if you've got  a buzz on. I'll definitely be back!

First stop from the airport was the Peppermill! We had an hour wait but new it was worth it!
We sat in the fireside lounge and had a couple of beverages. The Bloody Mary's are the best in town!!
We finally got in and enjoyed the "Western Fruit Plate", banana bread and marshmallow crème sauce. The fruit plate is our favorite but we also added a waffle. BIG AND FLUFFY!!
Service is always exceptional and we rested and planned our day with the buz of happy vegas vistors telling their stories of woes and greatness...I LOVE THIS PLACE!!
You can't complete the Vegas trip if you don't visit this restaurant! . Foods are always amazing. The best chicken wings and French toast !!!!!

Kitschy and groovy! Hubbie and I loved the old vegas diner feel. The cocktail waitresses were even wearing black gowns! Def. for cool people that don't take themselves too seriously! 
It really is out there, by Riviera and has it's own parking lot and famous for being in several shows movies like Casino etc. Open 24 hours which is great and has a lounge/bar.

I know my mom would def. not appreciate it as it is old, not pretty and who knows if they ever dust those fake flower trees hanging over us. The couple we dined with were healthy/picky eaters so the huge portions might've been a turn off. 

But we'll be back! and next time we will SHARE!
corned beef hash was delish, fresh baked blueberry muffin was great, the seafood omelette was good but not too much seafood, kids meals are huge too (maybe share or skip it completely) Sampler huge. Even the salad my friend got was huge and came with fruit too. Mimosas were great! 
They take a postcard pic, then try to sell you a bigger copy for $15.

Sweet and simple from  a hotel and restaurant background. service from entry great and friendly staff great atmosphere and fast service and pretty good food . If ya want to sure a appetizers with a friend or even a army go with the Nachos!!

I didn't know about The Peppermill until my good friend Christine turned me on to its charms. Now I take all my out-of-town friends and family here. 

As others have said, the food is good, no matter what you order, and the portions are huge! The fruit plate, for instance, is large enough for 2 or more people. I love the ambiance of the neon lighting, the fake cherry trees, and the friendly staff. It's just so Vegas!  The cocktail waitresses wear these long, flowing black dresses and come into the restaurant from the lounge to take your drink orders. If you want to really get crazy with the drinks, order a Scorpion...it comes in a huge bowl with straws and is meant to be shared! You gotta see it to believe it! I shared one with my nephew and his wife and it was amazing. 

The Fireside Lounge is a trip all by itself. It looks to me like something out of the 1970's: shag carpeting, and a main sunken seating area around a flaming fountain. There are video screens everywhere showing music videos.  I have come here numerous times on dates, with friends, after photo shoots, etc. Just kicked back and had a drink (or two or three) and ordered appetizers. Again, love those friendly, attentive cocktail waitresses dressed in classy black! 

So if you want to have a good meal, or just a drink, stop by one of the best-kept local secrets in town...The Peppermill!

This place gives huge portions. I had the munch and my date had the corned beef hash. Both were decent. The coffee was good. The service was also good. Reason it gets 2 stars is because both me and my date had massive diarrhea, not the water dribble kind, but like the epic volcanic type, where your stomach growls like a feral cat and your butthole feels like a flamethrower. So, would I go back? Nah, the after effects are not worth huge portions.

AWESOME, AMAZING, DELICIOUS, A LOT! We visited this place three times because it was so yummy. We had the largest pancakes I've ever seen. The best omelet called the Marzarti which the highlight is the spaghetti sauce and the sour dough toast. I can say I'm not a late person but I ate almost the whole 8 egg omelet with the SAUCE. Also, their sampler is delic which we sub the shrimp out for curly fries. The wings are great, even the next day. WE WILL BE BACK!!!

We went because of the high recommendations. I wish we would have walked out as soon as we saw the tacky decor. Each meal is large enough to feed an entire family if that family wants a low quality meal. They definitively stress quantity over quality.  I suggest passing on this one.

Can't go wrong with this flashback from the past.  Located just between Encore and Riviera this place has a good selection for you after the long night of drinking. They pretty much serve you their entire menu all day. For the price and the cost you are better here than the massive crowds at the buffets or hash hash spots in the city.

If you want massive portions that take forever to get to your table, this is your place. I've eaten here, maybe 5 times over 15 years. Never a change. The food is not bad but not worth the wait for a table, wait for the server, wait for the food and wait for the to go box because you can't finish.

I went here while staying in Vegas. My party had 11 people and they accommodated us quite well. We only waited 10 minutes or less to be seated. The decor is super fun: neon lights, bright colors, etc. It has personality, for sure! Most of my group came for the country fried steak. I had the steak and eggs--it was good! My steak was cooked a perfect medium, as requested. It came with three eggs cooked however you'd like, hash browns, and toast/muffin/etc.  We were checked on throughout the meal and got all we needed. I would come back!

I always come here super late night when I'm in Vegas and i love it!! The food is SO good all of it! I have never had anything i was unhappy with. The menu is large there are so many options. I love the vibe of the place as well and the bar in the back is my favorite. The little seating areas are SO cool totally 80's and I love it! The fire pit in the water is a Nice place to sit at and snack after a long night of partying or working. Defiantly a locals spot and worth going to.

One of my absolute favorite places. It's old Vegas. It's fun, bright and cheery. The wait is usually long, but that's to be expected and not a deal breaker for me. We usually go for breakfast. The pancakes are to die for!

the food is surprisingly delicious! not your typical diner like dennys or cocos

huge portions. flavorful. friendly staff. clean environment.

pina coloda was delicious! drinks are decently price as well as the food. you won't feel ripped off. 

gotta love the old school vegas with neon lights.

i will be back!!
This is average diner food.  However the Peppermill is a Las Vegas institution to tourists and locals.  The decor reminds you of old Las Vegas.  This is a must for every time I'm in town.
AWWWWESOOOOMMMEEEE!!!!!! Hot waitresses, great atmosphere, great decor, food ROCKS! So glad we found out about this place. Ate here after a long night at EDC. Boom!

This is a throw-back for sure; but you couldn't ask for a better place just to hang out and chill.

I have enjoyed this place both times I have been now including most recently when I was there solo.

The bartenders are efficient and friendly as is the wait staff.  The drinks are well made and the food (I had the chicken quesadillas on my recent visit.) is  really good.

The fire pit at Fireside is pretty cool as are the comfy, curved bench/couch seating (with pillows).  It's a place you can really kick back and enjoy your evening.  You can just kick back relax, chill, and bask in the neon glow that is Fireside.

It is certainly a favorite stand-by to drop in every time I come into town now.

In town for a convention and needed a non sports book place to watch a hockey game. Web and Yelp mentioned they had a comfortable bar so I decided to check it out.

My bartenders Denise and Ruth were wonderful. The place was very busy but my drink was always full, they delivered my snacks, and were even able to help me charge my phone!!

Since I was watching the game I stayed at the bar, but the lounge looks great and I will check it out next time I'm in town. There are comfortable booths and a great circular fire pit. The waitresses were also very friendly. 

The margaritas were good. Can't speak to the food because I only had chips and salsa, but the restaurant and waiting area were packed when I was leaving. Might not have the big chef name or be associated with a casino but it suited my needs perfectly.

My boyfriend and I needed a break from the upscale, so we tried a place with neon lighting, short skirted cocktail servers and mirrored ceilings.  We sat kitty corner to a slew of hair band impersonators, which just seemed to enhance the absurdity of the place.  Our food was great, seemed healthier than most quick bite places and our cocktails were strong.  What more can one expect from one of the older dives in Vegas?

This stand alone restaurant on the Las Vegas Strip is serving some of the best breakfast food I've ever tasted.  The omelette's are unbelievably delicious and huge.  The western fruit plate is big enough to feed the entire table.  My favorite breakfast is a tie between the Masserati omelette and Joe's San Francisco Breakfast Special.  The  Pork Sliders are also perfect and so are the huge Bloody Marys.  

If you have to wait for a table (and even if you don't), you should have a pre-meal Bloody Mary or Mimosa in the Fireside Lounge.   

The service is great and everyone is very friendly.  This is my favorite breakfast restaurant in Vegas.  Also my favorite breakfast Bloody Mary and Mimosa (fresh squeezed orange juice).

The decor is awesome and the service was good, but the place was two or three bucks overpriced on every item and I thought the food was nothing special.  The eggs and hash browns were super buttery, which is not my thing at all, and all the alcoholic drinks were at least $8 (and were pretty small).  Its not a bad place, it just did not live up to my expectations as to price or quality of food.

Came here for breakfast and this place is awesome! My group didnt order anything else, we had the omelette.  That IN ITSELF is amazing!

Ho ho ho!  I dont think they make more creative and tasty omelettes.  Forget the IHOP, DENNY'S OR HOTEL OMELETTES! This place has out of the world, big and tasty omelttes.  My group had mediaterranean, veggie and this meat sauce one.  All tasty, good, blended well.

Food here is tasty... and slightly pricy, but worth the while.  Great ambiance too!

yummmmay!

my friend recommended we come here for brunch before departing vegas and it was such a great idea! 

even though the restaurant is not attached to a hotel and it's on the strip but there was definitely a wait for sunday brunch.  we had a party of 6 and it took us a good 40 minutes to get seated.  

i ordered the french toast collage and it was amahzinggg.  i'm not sure how they get their french toast to taste that good, but it does.  the sausages on the side weren't the shriveled dry ones either!  my friend got the cornbeef hash and that was delicious as well.  

great place for brunch and they have bar service for breakfast so if you're a suffering a hungry hangover stop by the peppermill restaurant to get the best f&b to cure your sorrows.
It's cool if you want to eat breakfast in a place that looks like a strip joint. The food is pretty but not a place I would go out of my way for.

This is place is a local  treasure!  This is a place that is done a true Vegas style!  

The lounge is swanky-tacky...  The sunken fireplace water thing practically hypnotized me as I gazed at it! 

The restaurant part is slightly better than normal diner food.  The portions were large.

Yes - 5 stars!  This is a one of kind original!

Overall excellent.  The decor is something from a bad 70's discotheque, but it grows on you.  Expect a delay, we were there at 1100 on a Saturday, and had about a 45 min wait.  You can hang out in the sunken lounge if you want, that was kind of neat, and the drinks were good.  The dining area is a zoo, very busy.  That was my only critique; the waitress was so busy, our water glasses never got refilled.  The food was great and the portions were huge, think almost Hash House A-Go-Go big.  My omelet was the size of a football, and my buddy's pancakes were the size of a large plate.  Cocktail waitresses roam the floor as well, so drinks are available.  If you are on the north part of the strip, definitely stop by.

Now you're in Vegas, having a great time, partying, taken in the sights, and shows etc... This place is to chill when you want to get away from the craziness of the Strip... This is also a place to take your date and chill with a drink after doing the shopping at the mall... The fireside lounge was quite nice... Drinks were resonable (hell you're in Vegas) 

We went back there the next morning for breakfast, even though there was a waiting time to eat, the food was not bad at all.. In fact, when you order a mimosa... You get a giant glass of mimosa!! :)

And again, the intimate atmosphere in the fireside lounge was absolutly perfect.. I mean you can actually have a real one on one date, share your favorite drink togehter, and actually tell yourself "thank god I got away to Vegas"  :)

I can HIGHLY recommend this place... A place to chill and relax from the craziness Vegas has to offer... Which is not a bad thing, but we all do need to recharge the batteries before going back onto the Strip!!  :)
Love this place!  Lots of character! Great food , big portions, excellent service. We loved Chelsea. Will go back every visit!

I kind of felt like I was in an old mobster movie in Las Vegas. I loved the fire pit, experiencing that and being able to take pictures, I felt like a tourist attraction. The food was ok, not really what I expected. But it was tasty enough. The seating was a bit squashy, but we made do and the service was pretty good.

****The Food & Prices are Worth the Wait****
We actually were looking for places around the Westgate and found this place on Yelp that was highly recommended, so we decided to give it a try!  It is located by the Riviera & Circus Circus on the strip, so people are able to walk off their food afterwards because there is a lot of food coming your way!!!  

1. Be prepared to wait-Giving any place in Vegas that is good and that does not have a reservation option, be prepared to wait.  There is not much seating areas up front so they will offer the lounge area to wait (highly recommended!) but usually everyone is waiting outside.

2. There are large booths & typical bar seating-There is plenty of room to sit and the decor is straight up vegas style!  If I blinked twice I would have thought I was in a party bus with trees!  I loved the seating arrangement and everyone was in a good mood and can easily talk to the booth next to you!

3. Waitresses were awesome (both times!) They let you know what is great on the menu and I did get everything in a timely manner...even though they were slammed!

4. Food for Days- For the first round, I received the breakfast pancake platter and the size of everything is incredibly huge!  You pay around 13-14 dollars, but it is worth it (especially if your hotel room has a fridge, you will have leftovers!)  The second round I got the French Toast Ambrosia...this I highly recommend!! French Toast with a whole bunch of "fresh" fruit on top smothered in whipped cream (if you want) with blueberry sauce!!! YUUUMMM!

This place does not disappoint!! I cannot explain about how much I love this place and cannot wait to go back!

Not living up to the hype. I was hoping to try something good, since I heard good things about Peppermill..but
Prices are expensive. I did like the vibe, but it took over 15 minutes to get waited on with water, and took a very long time as well to get our food. My friend did love her eggs benedict.

The Peppermill has a wonderful atmosphere reminiscent of the glitz and glamour of old school Las Vegas. The food is tasty and sized to epic proportions. It's a shame the service is slow and our waitress was grouchy.

I absolutely love the ambiance and the aesthetic here, but the food leaves much to be desired. Everything I've ever ordered here has been extremely blaśe. The appetizers are better than the entrees, however. The trashy specialty cocktails are humorous and I usually order one just to get in the Las Vegas spirit (I had the Bacardi O Dreamsicle last time). I recommend coming here for drinks and appetizers - the infamous fireside lounge is the coolest part of the building, if you can get a spot in there. It reminds me of something out of Fourside from the tripped-out Super Nintendo game Earthbound. You have to come here at least once as, from what I know, it is THE quintessential Las Vegas trash-diner... And it's open 24 hours! I hear there's quite the crowd at 4 AM ;)
Go there - large portions, fun older "Vegas" atmosphere.  The next time we visit Las Vegas, it's definitely on our food agenda.

The Taxi driver recommended to try this out. Cute place to try, nice decorations, unique but wasn't that impressed with the food I ordered. and you know its ALL about the food... Ordered the combo with sausages, eggs and pancakes. Pancakes are very big, comes with 3. Barely finished half of it.  Food was just Okay... worth a try just to see what its was all about...But probably wont be back.

The food here is actually pretty good. We sat in the fireside lounge where a dress code is enforced so make sure you dress to impress. The seating great for large groups or a more intimate setting. I love the fireputs for when it's a bit more chilly ouside even though everything is inside. It just makes it all nice and toasty for you. The wait staff is quite over worked and their attitude shows it. Our server could have been a bit more friendly had she not worked three 10 hour shifts three days in a row. Management needs to give these girls a break for goodness sake! Nevertheless, I love the nolstagic feeling of this place and will be back as I love visiting this establishment for old times sake.

wonderful restaurant! the atmosphere really adds the charm to a diner done Vegas style! and the wait staff is super attentive. 

food was excellent and are served in incredibly large portions, walked away very full!

didn't get a chance to check out the bar area, but definitely next time. 

my only qualm about this place is the crazy wait! I think because this place is so hyped up and the food is good, more people tend to gravitate at the usual meal times. I think next time we'll try going at a time that isn't so busy. and since this place is twenty four hours, I definitely seeing another trip in the near future!
Great breakfast, eggs cooked to perfection, no waiting to be seated or for our food.  Prices are high but its Vegas, so not unexpected.

Came here around 12:30am V-Day.  It was a little busy but nothing out of control and a few people waiting in the tiny "lobby".

Once we were seated it took AT LEAST 10min before our server WENDY came over to our table. How do you walk up to the customers who will be tipping you with sooo much attitude??! She asked what we wanted to drink, water and lemonade. We ordered the food while she was still standing there so we wouldn't have to wait again (which for some reason pissed her off to the point she felt the need to talk down to us). We told her what we wanted to her and she responded with, "Yea, yea I got it..see I wrote it down. What else?" Rude!

The lemonade never came out, so the bf waved down the next available sever. Our waitress came over within minutes to say, "Soo..You ordered lemonade?" We nod. She said, "You ordered it from me?". We nod again, and my bf told her she wrote it down. Instead of apologizing she rolls her eyes, walks away and someone else ended up bringing our drinks.

I ordered the tostada omlet and the bf ordered the hamburger. It didn't take long for the food to get out, buuut I'm not sure why tables seated waay after us got thier food first?? (Maybe I'm being too picky??) 

The food was just okay. Nothing I would ever come back or crave again. The hashbrowns were burnt on the outside and straight mush on the inside. Disgusting. I barely touched them. And OF COURSE she forgot to bring my side of toast.. whatever. I was already pissed off. Bf said his burger wasn't bad, but not worth the price. It came with fries but our shit server never gave us the option of onion rings, sweet potato fries etc. 

She also thought it was okay to keep bending over so everyone could see her underwear up her skirt. Seriously?? GTFO. 

Overall..
This will have to be the last restaurant on earth for me to return. Shitty ass servers, boring food, poor management and waaay over priced for what you get. I wish we would have just went to chinatown LOL!! 

I wanted to take a picture but my phone died ): 

Don't go here! You'll regret it. Run the other way faaaast!

This place is the bomb. Come hungry cuz the portions are humongous. As others have said the décor is something else. Glitzy neon everywhere, faux everything, this is Vegas. But the food is really good. The service was pleasant and though the place was pretty busy it wasn't loud so we could talk. I would bring my family.

Gaudy- the best word for the decor! I love this place.  We had gotten off the plane in the middle of the night and wanted good eats and drinks with convenient parking before heading to where we were staying. Peppermill seemed to be the type of place I was looking for.  I was delighted to see free parking and their own parking lot and equally as delighted at the ridiculous decor inside! The menu is huge. My boyfriend had an omelet and I had a panini and fries and we were both stuffed. Glancing around it looked as tho all of the portions were just as big. Once we were done eating we ventured into the lounge and had a seat at the bar and eventually seats cleared out at the cozy fire pit which is surrounded by red rounded couches and lots of mirrors. We enjoyed big tropical drinks and people watched.  The Peppermill is the type of place where anything seems to go...exhausted travelers such as ourselves were welcomed during the week but an evening gown and tux would work just as well. IF you want some late night eats after a night out drinking in a really cool environment I would call this a must do.
The food was awesome. Warning, however, the portions are HUGE.  The Denver omelet literally has a dozen eggs in it. Prepare to split a meal unless you can eat tons of food at one sitting!

They give you a nice portion of food. I had the chicken fried steak which was excellent. My husband had the Marco omelet, he said was good, and my son had a ham and cheese omelet, which he enjoyed. The service was ok, not the most attentive, but would I go back again yes! affordable, plentiful, and good tasting... works for us!!

Would give 4 stars  but giving it 3 due to having to ask random staff for items, as lacked quality service from hostess.

-Convenient parking
-The wait to get seated or get food is ridiculous
-At least they have huge screens with videos from around the world to entertain you while you wait
-The food is pretty good
-Coffee is very good as well
-The place is busy and hectic, I do not recommend to seat at the bar, as you might feel like you are a part of the whole hussle.

Have seen the place over the years of working in, or just visiting Las Vegas.  Finally decided to try it after reading all the reviews.  I enjoyed the look of the place, and the lounge is small, but kind of cool.

Don't know what all the 5 stars are for, perhaps for the look of the establishment, couldn't have been for the food.  The food was just okay.  I ordered eggs, sausage links and hash browns (they don't serve home fried potatoes - what a shame).  I was disappointed that the sausage links are turkey.  They also tasted like nasty.  My hash brown potatoes were cold.

Our service was terrible.  Our waitress seemed to prefer spending more time at other tables than ours.  I never got that second cup of coffee I asked for during the meal, only when I asked for the check did she ask if I still wanted more coffee.  Really?  We also asked for extra napkins and condiments, and towards the very end of our meal they came.  

One last thing.  I ordered a Bloody Mary at the lounge while waiting to eat breakfast.  For the price, you'd think it would be fantastic.  Not.  Plain tomato juice and a splash of booze.  It tasted like I was drinking plain tomato juice.  I was very, very disappointed, sitting in those very, very uncomfortable chairs at the bar.

My overall opinion is to stay away from the place, as it serves up food just a notch below Denny's.  It's bloody Mary's are terrible.  Both the food and the drinks are overpriced for what you're receiving, especially compared to other restaurants.  The service was for me terrible, especially when noticing that how they treat you like shit, then dote on others around you.      If you're going to cook and serve food, at least cook and serve it the same for each customer.  Not specific ones.

They seem to pat themselves on the back for having a restaurant with a lounge that has survived there for awhile (just an observation from the menu).  All I have to say is people are idiots if they keep coming back.  Over priced food and drinks.  Underwhelming flavor.  Terrible service.  Trust me, you'd be better off at McDonald's.

I went here the first time in about 1974. We went there nightly in those days. We ate in the front and drank in the lounge. Well, many years passed and my husband is always looking for things to surprise me with in Vegas. It seldom works. But he said I'm taking you to somewhere really different and when we pulled in I laughed. I hadn't been here in at least 20 years. We went to the lounge and ordered a drink by the firepit. That was fantastic. Then we ordered food and literally nothing was good. Totally inedible. So, my advice stick to drinks. I'd give it 5 stars for drinks, 1 for food, and -10 for the creeps in the parking lot. Still overall really fun.

Great food. Crowded, but they handle it very well. Give good estimates on wait. 
They told us 25 minutes and it was around 22.
Only 4 stars because the food is good but a little over priced.
There $22 dollar steak is not really worth it. Close but not quiet.

Love every thing I order from here! I get small oatmeal and its delicious. Eggs benedict...freaking awesome. Pancakes...yeah, you know it. So, I usually eat breakfast but I am coming back to update as soon as I order something from main menu...just don't know when I will get over breakfast yet.  Oh, and a full bar for breakfast...I love the grown-up version of Rainforest Cafe.

I heard great things about the Peppermill for years and finally made the effort to check it out. The food was delicious! Portions are large enough for you to share with your bestie. After dinner we went into the lounge and had cocktails. A cozy little spot to have a couple drinks and honey roasted peanuts before heading out to the club.

I ordered a burger, medium-done and it came back completely bloody no less than 4 times.  Not pink; like raw, uncooked, bleeding meat.  Of course I dig the look on the inside of the place but even by Vegas standards (read: very, very low), this restaurant is terrible.

I've heard about this place through a friend that this was the place to go for breakfast, other then the fact that this is the place to go for an incredible atmosphere.

The waitress did get a little bothered that chose a booth and vented to the hostess a little. I just chalked it up to "Vegas Kitch" then I sat myself at the counter after I mentioned my little dilemma.

The bar is full of personality from both the patrons and waitresses... very friendly. the menu is extensive and the food is delicious. Definitely looking forward to eating here again.

I came here with 15 of my other family members at around 11:30pm. The first thing I thought was COOL I love the neon decor. I'm into anything old school & funky. The menu has your typical diner type food (like Denny's as others would say), but everything seemed overpriced. I wasn't in the mood for anything else but salad, soup, & bread. I had their garden salad, mushroom cream soup, and some garlic bread. Sadly the only thing I liked much out of all three was the bread, but I didn't even finish it. My boyfriend had a cheeseburger & we had "heard" that the burgers here were humongous. His wasn't even big at all, and he claims it was "alright". However my nephew ordered a mushroom burger & his was big! I saw a few other tables who ordered the nachos (from the appetizer menu)..boy that thing is HUGE!!! I would've been down for that instead :P My other cousin ordered the quesadilla which looked delicious but she didn't seem to finish it. Most of my other family members ordered breakfast & they seemed satisfied; they came in huge portions. 

Anyways, I wasn't as pleased so idk if I'm willing to come back & try something else. It just seems like a restaurant that catches your eye right off the Strip, and it lures you in.

I love this place the margaritas are soooo yummy! the nachos are yummy! One time we ordered the fruit platter. OMG so much of everything and they give you a mini banana bread with it!! So fluffy and delishious!  I love the classy cocktail waitresses, and the over all mood of this place. You can be dressed up or dressed down, everyone is welcomed at all times of the day! 24/7!! One of my favorite places!! love the neon lounge!! too cozy!

Service is AMAZING, food is incredible. My husband had the joes San Francisco favorite, and I had the tostado omelet.  The chili in my omelet was soooooo good and the portion sizes are incredibly large. I also ordered a Hawaiian sunset drink that I finished before I even got my food.  SO GOOD!!!

Love this place...It is where I have breakfast when I visit Vegas....The food is not like the best food I have ever had ...but seriously they never disappoint if you need breakfast or some late night eats...

Was hesitant when I first walked in with the flamboyant decor and the questionable reviews.... however I was so surprised how wonderful the food was. 

I visited the establishment around 1130am on a Saturday. Service was good, food came out in a reasonable fashion - portions were huge!

Definitely a must try in Vegas!

Mission:  Find an old-school lounge in Vegas.

This place intrigued me from the start, but I almost didn't walk inside. I thought it would be in a casino, but from the outside it looks like an old Denny's complete with cheesy writing on the windows. But just ignore all the families waiting for a table as you bypass the restaurant and venture to the lounge for tropical drinks and shenanigans.

This is what a 70s pick up bar looks like in my dreams. Jack, Larry, Chrissy and Janet would love it! A dark jungle filled with couches and vines and touches of neon on the ceiling. Servers are lovely ladies in long black dresses slit to the hilt who join you on your lounge when taking your order. If you don't mind being part of the PDA show, sit on a loveseat in the firepit and become mesmerized by the bubbling electric blue liquid. Couples that want a little more privacy, should sit at one of the tables.

The majority of their cocktails are fruity tropical drinks and they pour heavy.  My early drinking days were filled with pina coladas and mai tais, but I've since transitioned to elegant cocktails. So it was like handing the reigns back to my early-20s self. I didn't have a care in the world here. They have a few beers, but nothing on tap. Prices are a bargain compared to other lounges on the Strip.

I've got to admit that there are a few buzzkills to an otherwise ridiculously awesome Vegas experience. There are TVs everywhere and they play a continuous loop of bizarre music videos and performance pieces. For every bit of Vegas spectacle (Cher) there was something absolutely ridiculous (early Mandy Moore or really late Hall & Oats). About half of the acts couldn't even be identified. It was sort of like watching and listening to a slo-mo hair band audio car crash. The more significant issue was the continual interruption of the speaker announcing that tables were ready in the restaurant. 

But if you can tune out those distractions, it is a swingingly good time. Mission accomplished!
Food was amazing! Well worth the wait and the portions were generous. Hopefully it doesn't take me 12 more years to return!

Away from the 24 hour buzz of the casinos and entertainment parks that occupy the strip you'll find the Peppermill Restaurant.... This place is a landmark and an excellent venue to escape the entertainment complex and enjoy a quality meal with a little 1960's charm. The female staff here are a bunch of old Vegas retiree dancers that wear tiny jumpers and shiny tights! (bow chica wow wow!) It's also got a kind of jungle decor to it, plus all kinds of shiny mirrors and neon lights - quite tacky. The food is great with enormous servings that can easily be shared between 2 and sometimes possibly 3 people. A good variety of breakfast choices 24/7. You'll definitely hit the food jackpot when eating here. Recommended to any Vegas visitor who want to enjoy a solid dining experience.

Huge portions reasonably priced with great food. Eight of us ate brunch here today.  The burgers, omelettes, country steak and gyro dishes were great.  Awesome onion rings. Highly recommend this restaurant.  Nice Vegas decor. Good for families.  Recommended by the locals as a place where they frequent.

Huge portions. Decent food. After eating in their dining room one night, ordering take out the next night - I was told I couldn't order take out the following night b/c another customer ordered take out and didn't show up. That's like my business saying I had a customer who didn't pay an invoice once before, so I'm going to stop providing services to everybody now. You don't stay in business long with that mentality. 
As a side note - both times I was in there - it was 90% empty.
